title: Head of Artificial Intelligence - kom og stå for udviklingen af den nyeste teknologi i DSB!
description: Denne hjemmeside bruger cookies Denne side viser alle cookies som kan fremkomme på candidate.hr-manager.net domænet og listen herunder er derfor ikke cookies som fremgår hos alle. Hvis du tillader cookies, accepterer du at Talentech og tredjeparter, gemmer de cookies, som du har valgt. Hvis du ikke giver samtykke, vil vi kun gemme de cookies, som er nødvendige for at du kan bruge siden. Du kan altid ændre dit samtykke ved at klikke på knappen nederst i venstre hjørne. Hjemmesiden kan ikke fungere ordentligt uden disse cookies. F.eks. dit foretrukne sprog, eller den region, du befinder dig i. Vi bruger ikke cookies af denne type. Statistiske cookies giver hjemmesideejere indsigt i brugernes interaktion med hjemmesiden, ved at indsamle og rapportere oplysninger anonymt.Bemærk at disse cookies er generelle for domænet candidate.hr-manager.net og derfor ikke fremgår hos alle. Loven fastslår, at vi kan gemme cookies på din enhed, hvis de er strengt nødvendige for at sikre leveringen af den tjeneste, du udtrykkeligt har anmodet om at bruge. For alle andre typer cookies skal vi indhente dit samtykke. Dette websted bruger forskellige typer af cookies. Nogle cookies sættes af tredjeparts tjenester, der vises på vores sider. Du kan til enhver tid ændre eller tilbagetrække dit samtykke fra Cookiedeklarationen på vores hjemmeside. Få mere at vide om, hvem vi er, hvordan du kan kontakte os, og hvordan vi behandler persondata i vores Privatlivspolitik. Angiv venligst dit samtykke-ID og -dato, når du kontakter os angående dit samtykke. Få den bedste brugeroplevelse med hurtigere hastighed, sikkerhed og privatliv ved at bruge den nyeste version af Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari eller Opera.   ×                                          Head of Artificial Intelligence – kom og stå for udviklingen af den nyeste teknologi i DSB!    Kunne du tænke dig at   lede et team af dygtige, veluddannede og entusiastiske specialister inden for AI, ML og Big Data?  sætte retningen for en endnu bedre udnyttelse af teknologien og leverancerne på området?  nudge os til at udbrede og øge Artificial Intelligence i DSB?   Vi har siden 2016 udviklet og implementeret projekter som dynamisk prissætning af vores billetprodukter, pladsanvisning i S-togene, automatisk detektering af graffiti på togene, udrulning af chatGPT-løsninger til fri afbenyttelse af alt DSB-personale og meget mere.  Vi har derigennem øget den personlige sikkerhed for vores personale, optimeret processerne og forbedret kundetilfredsheden.  Velkommen til Artificial Intelligence!  I DSB har vi valgt at skalere vores arbejde med Artificial Intelligence for at sikre den bedst mulige kundeoplevelse og de mest effektive processer i dagligdagen.  I øjeblikket er vi otte medarbejdere med ekspertise inden for machine learning, computer vision, data science, Generative AI, softwareudvikling, løsningsarkitektur og forretningsanalyse.  Vi arbejder med det meste af Azure Tech Stacken og er i proces med at konsolidere data til vores nye Data Lakehouse.  Til AI & ML anvender vi Databricks, MLflow, Azure Data Factory, Azure Event Hubs, IoT Hub og Solace.  Vi er en meget efterspurgt ressource, og vi skal udvide afdelingen.  Vi tror på, at kombinationen af data, automatisering og menneskelig indsigt kan skabe helt særlige resultater for vores passagerer.  TrAIn – hvad er det?  Vi har netop igangsat programmet TrAIn, der både skal udvikle AI use cases og udrulle Generative AI i hele DSB.  Sammen med de bedste eksterne partnere vil vi gentænke DSB’s kerneprocesser og strategi ved brug af AI for at forbedre kundeoplevelsen og togenes punktlighed.  TrAIn-programmet er et billede på alt det, vi vil på AI-fronten. Og direktionen er med.  Vi starter med vores trafikinformation.  Når togene er forsinkede, vil vi bruge big data fra togenes status og placering samt mønstergenkendelse og forudsigelser af den daglige togdrift.  Det vil gøre os i stand til at give kunderne en hurtigere, konsistent og mere personlig trafikinformation.  Som Head of AI får du en betydningsfuld rolle i TrAIn.  Hvad går jobbet ellers ud på?  Din fornemste opgave bliver at bygge, udvikle og opjustere vores indsatser indenfor AI på tværs af DSB.  Over for teamet vil du   Lede, sparre, skabe gode rammer og bane vejen for en professionel indsats  Rekruttere nye dygtige kollegaer    Samarbejdet med andre interessenter handler om at   Sørge for, at forretningens behov bliver omsat til udvikling af tekniske løsninger, der skaber resultater for alle parter  Formidle budskaber til mange målgrupper som IT-specialister, direktion, administrativt og kørende personale  Styre og samarbejde med eksterne leverandører i større strategiske implementeringer    I forhold til teknologien er det din opgave at   Sikre, at vi er på forkant med de muligheder, ny teknologi giver os  Udvikle og udrulle AI-strategi i DSB samt tage de rette initiativer, så vi overholder governance, regulering og etiske krav på området   Tech savvy & erfaren IT-leder – er det dig?  Vi forestiller os, at du er en entusiast inden for udvikling af ML/AI og interaktionen mellem teknologi og mennesker. Du kan begejstres over teknologiske trends og muligheder på feltet.  Du har erfaring med   udrulning af AI eller andre transformative programmer i en stor organisation  at opbygge et eller flere leveranceteams på dataområdet  personaleledelse inden for udvikling af AI og machine learning   Du kommunikerer lige så godt på engelsk som dansk, da vores interne sprog i IT er engelsk, og flere i teamet taler primært engelsk.  Hvad tilbyder DSB?  Nogle af vores personalegoder er   Gratis transport med DSB  Fleksible arbejdstider og mulighed for hjemmearbejde et par dage om ugen  Træning i DSB’s eget fitnesscenter og PureGym  Pension og sundhedsforsikring  Frokostordning og mulighed for at købe mad med hjem   Læs mere her om personalegoder og om DSB som arbejdsplads .  Søg nu  Ansøgningsfristen er d. 17. december 2023.   Vi evaluerer og gennemfører samtaler løbende, så skynd dig at søge.  Upload dit materiale og evt. en ansøgningsvideo på vores jobportal.  Har du spørgsmål, så ringer du bare til Søren Friis, som er Director for BI, Analytics & Office of the CIO på tlf. 2468 8996.  #LI-Hybrid #LI-BS1       I DSB bliver du en del af en selvstændig offentlig virksomhed, der investerer milliarder i nye elektriske tog, trygge stationer og attraktive produkter og services. Vi er fælles om viljen til at give vores kunder den bedste rejseoplevelse og til at skabe et grønnere og mere sammenhængende Danmark.  Hos os vil du opleve, at der er gode karrieremuligheder med balance mellem arbejde og fritid. Alle er velkomne - uanset køn, etnisk baggrund, handicap, alder, seksuel orientering og religion.  - Plads til alle på rejsen mod det bæredygtige -             Application due 17-12-2023   Workplace Telegade 2, Taastrup, Danmark  Homepage dsb.dk        Contact  [Project.ContactPerson1.ProfileImage-]   Søren Friis Holm  Afdelingschef        24688996     [Project.ContactPerson2.ProfileImage-]               [Project.ContactPerson3.ProfileImage-]               [Project.ContactPerson4.ProfileImage-]                 Flere ledige stillinger                                            ShareThis Copy and Paste

title: Software Engineer with life sciences experience
description: Home    Available positions   Login My profile My profile                  Software Engineer with life sciences experience   We are looking for a talented Software Engineer to design and build applications for our scientists and accelerate our digital transformation About us Minerva Imaging’s vision is to become the leading contract research and contract development organization for targeted radionuclide therapy and imaging, enabling improved treatment regimens for cancer patients. Our focus is on the use of advanced animal models within oncology and cardiovascular diseases and in vivo molecular imaging for translational research and drug development. We aim to excel in delivering customized cancer radiopharmaceutical research and serve as an extended research team to our collaborators. We have built a global leading R&D platform for targeted radionuclide therapy and Contract Development and Manufacturing (CDMO) to enable integrated planning and faster execution of promising new radionuclide theragnostic projects in close collaboration with leading researchers, biotech, and pharmaceutical companies. Minerva is at the forefront of R&D in the theragnostic area. We are in a very fast-paced environment, where our scientists directly impact the advancement of new improved, and lifesaving drugs for seriously ill cancer patients. We have the ambition to make a difference for our clients, collaborating on advancing new treatment modalities for patients. Our plans for the new Software Engineer The role will support Minerva Imaging's digital transformation and play a crucial role in our application development, accelerating our laboratory workflows and supporting our scientists with solutions. As a Software Engineer, you will create a strong relationship to our scientists, understand their needs and develop the right solution for them. The ideal candidate will have experience with both the life science industry and software development. You have experience within web development, adapting open-source software in a corporate environment and programming e.g. in python and experience with databases. You will be joining a small team and as such you will quickly become a key team player with a wide variety of tasks. Minerva Imaging is a growing company and you will get the opportunity to help shape both your own tasks and the future digital infrastructure of the company. You will be joining the department of digital solutions and technology consisting of IT and data/image processing professionals. Tasks: Design and development of software to support our in-house research and development organization Deployment and support of in-house developed web apps Assess current data handling and pro-actively come up with solutions Improving the overall data flow within the company Support setting up and maintaining data processing and analysis tools Ability to cross-collaborate throughout the whole organization within the various disciplines in the company Provide technical support and training to the users of our apps Experience: Background in software development, including programming languages such as R, Python, SQL, JavaScript, HTML and CSS Experience with software development or data analysis within  life sciences Experience with version control (Git) and containerization technologies (docker) Familiar with agile principles and previous experience using tools like Azure DevOps to manage software or data science projects, track progress and improve collaboration Previous experience in implementing automated testing and deployment processes is a plus Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Life Sciences or related fields with  2+ years of experience Problem-solving and make-it-work attitude Good team player and eager to learn Excellent communication skills in English, both written and oral Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Thrive in a fast-paced and service-oriented organization English is required and Danish is an advantage Please submit your application no later than 30th of November. The application must include a motivated cover letter and a CV addressing the listed qualifications and must be submitted through our application portal. Applications will be evaluated continuously.  If you have questions regarding the position, please contact Moritz Braig on mob@minervaimaging.com About Minerva Imaging Minerva Imaging is a scientifically driven CRO/CDMO founded in 2011 counting 130 employees. Our focus is on the use of advanced animal models within oncology and cardiovascular diseases and in vivo molecular imaging for translational research and drug development. We engage with our collaborators to understand their scientific questions and discuss how our methods and capabilities can provide answers. We are rapidly growing, and the right candidate will be a key contributor to maintaining the scientific foundation and our approach to research while expanding our business. You will join a highly specialized CRO/CDMO, with ambitions of taking disease treatment to the next generation of personalized medicines. We are an informal organization with a strong focus on open and honest communication. We value humor and a natural care for one another, meaning stepping up and lending a helping hand to a colleague when needed. We offer a combined compensation package which includes a base salary, pension and an attractive bonus program. We believe in creating an agile working environment, so we have flexible working options including the possibility of partly working from home. We care about our employees’ well-being and offer health insurance and a quality conscious lunch scheme and arrange monthly social activities. Minerva Imaging is an equal opportunity employer and encourage candidates of all backgrounds and experiences to apply. Follow Minerva Imaging on LinkedIn for the latest news.   Apply   Share in your network               Deadline:  30/11/2023     Contact person:       Moritz Braig  Department Manager       Job area:  Digital solutions and Technology    Position type:  Full time                       Minerva Imaging Lyshøjvej 21 DK-3650 Ølstykke +45 38 25 20 15  info@minervaimaging.com                   Powered by Emply           Login  Have you applied for a job or created a job agent? title: Data Engineer – Maternity leave
description:

Vendors  Linkedin      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                      Career menu       Careers    Event Calendar    Jobs    Recruitment Process    Become a Graduate    Career & Development Opportunities    Diversity    Working at one of our biogas plants    Departments    Locations    People      Employee  Log in  Candidate  Log in to Connect  Homepage  nature-energy.com                Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail             Nature Energy Odense   Data Engineer – Maternity leave  You are responsible for developing the dataflow and implementing software solutions for the world's largest producer of Biogas     Apply            A key position within Nature Energy's biological work with data processing and statistics You will be part of Nature Energy's R&D and Biological Support department, with a total of 22 employees, who conduct research within biogas. An MS SQL database exists to keep track of all the data generated from our own and external laboratories. In addition, we have just started to implement LIMS (Laboratory Information Management System) as a tool to help track workflows for each analysis, implement automatized QC on our process and results, and facilitate a better dataflow. You get the responsibility as a “Product Owner” where you will implement and configure LIMS in close collaboration with external consultants within Europe and our own Laboratory staff. Work tasks can among other things include:  Implement and adjust dataflow between LIMS, new Dataverse/Power Apps, and existing MS SQL databases  Project Management and communication with external consultants - and internal resources within R&D, Laboratory, and IT  Assist in the definition and implementation of Quality Control for analyses and data processing  Data processing  Statistics on laboratory data, for both production and research (data visualizations and analyses)  Your workplace will be at our headquarter in Odense. The maternity leave is expected to be approx. 1 year. IT- and Data profile with Project Management skills and motivation for the green transition You probably have a degree in data science, data analysis, computer science, software engineering, or similar. The most important thing is that you thrive in the intersection between data processing, project management, and programming. You have already acquired your first experience with project management in the field of IT or Software implementation, so you can help facilitate a solid foundation for the data handling procedures in the laboratory. In addition, it is an advantage if you know Python and SQL or have other related programming experience - especially with API’s. We are convinced that the personal match is crucial for us to be successful in the collaboration. That is why we invest in your development and give you the necessary knowledge and insight so that we jointly ensure that you succeed in the position. In addition to being motivated to contribute to the green transition, you are structured and have an analytical approach to tasks. You appear calm and accommodating when working with colleagues and consultants. Working at Nature Energy By joining Nature Energy, you will be part of a highly experienced and ambitious team of leaders in the circular economy. Our common denominator is that we want to build a sustainable future for our planet and our people. we couldn’t be more excited about what the future holds. Today, Nature Energy employs more than 500 dedicated employees across offices in Europe and North America. Headquartered in Denmark, Nature Energy is the European market leader in the development, design, construction, and operation of large, industrialized biogas plants. The company owns and operates 14 biogas plants in Europe and is launching new biogas projects in Europe and North America. You can read more about Nature Energy at www.natureenergy.com and our recruitment process here: https://nature-energy.com/careers/recruitment-process  Interested? Your team and the rest of Nature Energy are excited about you joining our ambitious growth, so be sure to submit your application today! If you have any questions, feel free to contact Data Scientist Anita Eckert at +45 31 76 96 35. We will review applications continuously, so make sure to submit your application today by using our online application form by clicking “Apply for the position” below.       Locations   Nature Energy Odense   Employment type  Full-time                  Contact  Alexander Vinde  Talent Acquisition Specialist
         – 
        People & Culture             Job opportunities ⤵           Process Engineer, Ventilation Systems   Nature Energy Aarhus, Nature Energy Odense      Financial Controller   Finance  ·  Nature Energy Odense      Financial Assistant   Finance  ·  Nature Energy Odense           More jobs                   Nature Energy Odense          A unique career - Join us         About Nature Energy  Nature Energy is the market leader in turning many million tonnes of biomass into green, CO2-neutral gas as effectively as possible. We collect and deliver biomass from businesses, agriculture, and households and return the degassed biomass to agriculture that recycles nutrients. This is a circular economy at its best. At the same time, we ensure that the surrounding community around our biogas plants remains as undisturbed as possible by transport and odors. Nature Energy is already making a big difference in the green transition, but our ambitions are even more significant. That is why Nature Energy is investing intensively in research, including our laboratory at our head office in Odense. The laboratory is a site for research into refining the technology to extract more energy from biomass and produce even better fertilizer for agriculture. The laboratory is also researching new biomasses to produce green, CO2-neutral energy in the future. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                     Senior Full Stack Developer for Generative AI Projects     About the job  At KPMG NewTech, we are passionate about AI and how new technologies can change the way companies and organizations work.  We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our growing Machine Learning and Quantum team. If you are passionate about Generative AI, and the newest trends and developments in the industry, you might be our new colleague.  We manage AI projects from idea to implementation  At KPMG NewTech, our Machine Learning team manages AI projects from start to finish: identifying emerging business issues, crafting innovative models, executing and rolling out scalable systems, and empowering peers and customers to leverage the full potential of AI.  As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you will work on different projects critical to our clients' needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects.  We expect you to display leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic to support other team members in developing expertise.  Our team  The Machine Learning and Quantum team is focused on delivering solutions using the latest developments in the AI space. Our team consists of diverse individuals with backgrounds in data science, software, UX, business, and engineering. We are passionate about using AI to solve real-world problems for our clients and take pride in being experts in the field.  Currently, we are heavily focused on generative AI and how recent and ongoing developments are shaping the landscape.  Our team is dedicated to creating an inclusive and welcoming work environment for all employees. We value diversity and believe it is crucial to our success.  About our newest team member:  Minimum qualifications:   B.E. or M.Sc . in Computer Science or a related field.  5+ years of industry experience.  Excellent communication and teamwork skills.  Demonstrated ability to lead complex software development projects from conception to deployment.   Preferred qualifications:   Solid proficiency in frontend technologies such as Angular/React, Typescript/JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS/SCSS.  Experience with backend languages and frameworks like C#, Python, NodeJS, SQL, and NoSQL.  Familiarity with cloud providers like AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus.  Knowledge of containerization, such as Docker.  Having a pragmatic approach without over-engineering.  Drive for continuous learning and staying updated with the evolving tech landscape.  Knowledge and experience in the generative AI space.   Responsibilities:   Interact directly with clients to understand their requirements, provide technical insights, and ensure that the development aligns with their expectations.  Lead the design and implementation of scalable software architecture.  Foster a team culture that values inclusiveness, collaboration, and making a meaningful impact.  Mentor junior developers and team members, providing guidance and support for their growth and development. Lead by example in both technical expertise and professional conduct.  Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices.   Why join us?  We offer a dynamic and inclusive work environment that supports your professional growth and development. With competitive compensation and benefits, flexible work arrangements, and a commitment to learning and innovation, we provide opportunities for you to excel in your career.  At our organization, we value and respect diversity. We believe that a diverse workforce leads to better outcomes for our clients and employees. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, abilities, identities, and perspectives to apply.  Please don’t hesitate to contact Barbara Isaksen, Manager in Machine Learning and Quantum, at +45 31415095 or baisaksen@kpmg.com , if you’d like to know more about the position.              Application due 17/12/2023  Start date Start as soon as possible   Position type Management Consulting      Work hours  Workplace Copenhagen       Website      Questions regarding the position     Barbara Isaksen  Manager        baisaksen@kpmg.com                                                   Follow us               KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 144 countries and have over 236,000 people working in member firms around the world. We work closely with a broad range of clients, such as business corporations, governments and public sector agencies and not-for-profit organisations. We support them in mitigating risks and exploiting business opportunities.  KPMG in Denmark is the fastest growing professional services firm in Denmark, achieving 1,365,279 million DKK in revenue in FY22. Together, over 1100 employees and partners work to deliver value to our clients through a combination of deep local insight and strong global perspectives. We tailor our approach to the challenge at hand, and we are constantly pushing boundaries to deliver the best services and solutions for our clients.  KPMG P/S, Dampfærgevej 28, 2100 København Ø, Tel: +45 7070 7760, CVR no. 25578198                               ShareThis Copy and Paste

Data Scientist til Skade DKs AI og Data Science team            Er du en stærk Data Scientist med interesse for Operational Analytics, og har du en interesse for at udvikle og drifte prædiktive modeller, udføre eksperimentelle analyser, og optimere eksisterende applikationer? Har du lyst til at blive en del af vores AI og Data Science team, med højt engagement, masser af gode ideer og god stemning, hvor alle arbejder på at gøre en forskel? Så er det dig, vi søger!    Vi er i Tryg i gang med en større udvikling inden for digital transformation. Her spiller AI og Data Science en vigtig rolle, og til dette har vi behov for flere dygtige Data Scientists og Data Engineeres til at understøtte de mange spændende initiativer.      Om os | Bred kontaktflade og fuld fokus på samarbejde  AI og Data Science teamet sidder som en del af Data & BI afdelingen, som servicerer og understøtter vores Skadebehandlingsafdeling i DK med de rigtige data-løsninger til effektiv driftsstyring, øget digitalisering, kundeoplevelser, kvalitetssikring og procesoptimering. Afdelingen består af talentfulde kollegaer som arbejder inden for Data Engineering, Data Science og Business Intelligence. Du kommer derfor til at indgå i et stærkt fagligt miljø, hvor der konstant er fokus på at sikre en kontinuerlig udvikling. Fordi vi er en afdeling bestående af flere teams med mange forskellige kompetencer, har vi et stort fokus på sparring med hinanden, kompetenceudvikling samt et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø – der gør arbejdsdagen sjovere og nemmere.    Vi lægger stor vægt på et samarbejde på tværs af afdelinger og funktioner, og du vil som Data Scientist i AI & Data Science teamet have et tæt samarbejde med kollegaer og vores Data Scientist community. Gennem samarbejde med forskellige kollegaer og samarbejdspartnere bliver du rustet med et solidt netværk, som sætter dig i stand til at løse dine opgaver bedre og hurtigere, og som samtidig sikrer en kontinuerlig udvikling af dine kompetencer. Det er en forudsætning, at du har en naturlig tilgang til samarbejde med forskellige kollegaer, og ser det som en del af dit arbejde at søge viden og sparre med andre kollegaer.      Om jobbet | Operational Analytics & Data Science  Som Data Scientist kommer du til at have mange forskellige opgaver inden for Operational Analytics & Data Science. Det betyder, at du bl.a. vil arbejde med udvikling og drift af prædiktive modeller, A/B testing, webservices og cloud computing. Fokus er at skabe værdi, og derfor kan løsningen i nogle tilfælde være simple regler og i andre tilfælde mere avancerede statistiske modeller.    Tryg har en ambitiøs datastrategi og arbejder målrettet for at etablere en Cloud baseret data- og analyseplatform, så det bliver hurtigere og nemmere at sikre tilgængeligheden af data, forbedre processer og sikre de rigtige værktøjer.    Dine arbejdsopgaver som Data Scientist vil typisk være:   Udvikle og træne prædiktive modeller  Drifte modeller og applikationer i skyen  Integrere datakilder i nye og eksisterende applikationer  Effektmåling via monitorering og A/B testing  Udvikle services til interaktion og overvågning af applikationer     De vigtigste værktøjer, som vi benytter, er bl.a. Microsoft Azure med Python, Kubernetes, Docker, GitLab, Kafka og SQL, men vi er meget åbne for at tage nye teknologier i brug. Derudover, har vi ambitioner om i højere grad at gøre brug af GenAI og LLM, hvilket vi håber du har lyst til at bidrage til.      Om dig | Skarp Data Scientist med fokus på værdiskabende Data Science løsninger  Vi forventer, at du har en relevant uddannelse inden for Computer Science, Datalogi, Statistik, Matematik eller tilsvarende. Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har hands-on erfaring med end-to-en Machine Learning processen, der bl.a. omfatter:   Databehandling  Model udvikling  Implementering og monitorering af modeller i produktion     Der er en forventning om, at du har kendskab til de mest almindelige Data Science værktøjer og sprog, og som et minimum er flydende i Python. Udover Python, så benytter vi Kubernetes Microsoft Azure, Docker, GitLab, Kafka, SQL mv. og et kendskab til disse vil være en fordel.    Vigtigst af alt er dog, at du brænder at gøre en forskel gennem udvikling af prædiktive modeller og eksperimentelle analyser sammen med os!      Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!  Hvis du kan genkende dig selv i beskrivelsen, send gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler og lukker processen, når vi har fundet den rette. Ansøgningsfrist er d. 15. december.    Har du spørgsmål eller ønsker at vide mere, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Data & BI, Anette Schrøder Mikkelsen via mail: anette.m@tryg.dk .                    job rekvisition ID:  25668        Vi er en del af Solsikkeprogrammet og opfordrer alle uanset kønsidentitet, alder, baggrund, handikap eller oprindelse til at søge stillingen. Vi er stolte af at have høj medarbejdertilfredshed, stærk faglighed og lige muligheder for at udvikle sin karriere i Tryg-koncernen. Tryg er Skandinaviens største skadesforsikringsselskab med aktiviteter i Danmark, Norge og Sverige. I Danmark består koncernen blandt andet af Tryg, Alka, TJM og Tryg Garanti. TryghedsGruppen er hovedejer af Tryg-koncernen og står bag TrygFonden. Sammen arbejder vi hver dag, på hver vores måde, for at gøre danskernes hverdag mere tryg. Se mere på www.tryg.dk             Ansøg nu »    Ansøg nu    Ansøg nu        Start ansøgning med LinkedIn                  Start           Vent venligst... title: Arla Futures - IT Graduate Programme 2024
description: Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content Link  Skip to main content          Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates                        Search by Keyword                         Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates             View Profile                      Search by Keyword        Filter using country       Loading...        Country/Region    All                            ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:     Create Alert         ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:                 APPLY NOW »             Arla Futures - IT Graduate Programme 2024           Location:    Viby J, DK              As a graduate in IT, you are about to kick-start your career towards the forefront of technology-driven solutions and IT management. Immerse yourself in hands-on expertise, through training, dedicated mentors, and a great network, as you help orchestrate cutting-edge solutions throughout our IT organisation.    Our IT Graduate Programme is a dynamic two-year opportunity designed to kick-start your career right after graduation, allowing you to specialise and grow in your chosen field. After the programme your journey will continue in Arla IT.    About Arla’s IT Graduate Programme?  You are about to embark on a journey that will propel your career and expertise in your chosen field of interest. You will have the opportunity to:     Enhance your skills and competencies with us. We offer tailored certifications and licenses in your area of interest, supporting your professional profile. Choose a specialist conference to fuel your passion and benefit from dedicated mentorship, to guide and support you all the way.      Join our graduate network, where you will enrich your personal and professional life. The IT Graduate Programme is one of Arla’s five graduate programs, all including talents in multiple areas located all over the world. The network will broaden your horizon and you will share the experiences together.      Experience Arla Culture through travel, learning, and collaboration. Benefit from training in personal development and gain insights and support in understanding your unique personality and use this as a driving force for personal growth.     What will make you a successful IT graduate?  First and foremost, we are looking for candidates who possess a curious mindset. We are open to various educational backgrounds, so what truly matters is your motivation for personal and professional growth within your field of interest and your desire to become our future IT expert shaping the future of Arla's cutting-edge tech solutions. Further, you:     Aspire to pursue a career in IT  Live in Denmark or Poland or willing to relocate  Hold a relevant bachelor's or master's degree completed no more than one year before the start of the IT graduate program in September 2024    What do we offer?  Dive into the links below to explore the opportunities within our exciting areas of Arla’s IT Graduate Programme:    Please click on the specific link(s) to apply for one or more roles you find interesting.   Software Development, Security and Data Science/Engineering – Aarhus (Read more and apply) or Poland (Read more and apply)   As a software development graduate, you will unleash your potential in building applications. You will work with backend technologies like .NET and C#, front-end frameworks (React, Angular), and analytics tools (Python, SQL, R). As part of the software development area, security is highly prioritized, ensuring robust infrastructure – an exciting path if this is within your passion.    As a Data Scientist/Engineering graduate, you will utilize state-of-the-art models and algorithms to gain valuable insights from data and solve critical business problems using new data-driven technologies. You will drive the best practices in cloud-based infrastructure and services and deliver data and advanced analytics across Arla’s value chain to enable colleagues to utilize data.    Technology Business Development Engineer – Aarhus  (Read more and apply)  As tech business development graduate, you will drive innovation while navigating the ever-evolving technological landscape. Excel in product/IT application, project management, change management, and cross-functional collaboration. Bridge IT and production to ensure systems meet production requirements and integrate technology with machinery and operation management.    User Experience – Aarhus  (Read more and apply)  As UX graduate, you will play a pivotal role in creating exceptional user experiences that directly impact our customers and colleagues. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create best-in-class user experiences by conducting user research, usability testing, creating user flows, facilitating workshops, and implementing design principles to enhance our digital products and services.    Arla Futures – our global graduate universe  As a graduate in Arla Foods, you become a part of Arla Futures – our global network across all our graduate programmes in the organisation. Together, you will embark on an exciting journey towards an impactful career in Arla Foods.    We offer a comprehensive platform designed to kick-start your professional growth, featuring structured trainings, invaluable mentorship, and an extensive network of fellow graduates. You will play a significant role in shaping our future and guiding the organisation in the right direction.    Application and contact  OBS! please apply via above link(s) and not below link . You are more than welcome to apply for one or more IT areas.  Our recruitment process is ongoing and designed to identify your potential to become one of our graduates in IT while also helping you decide if Arla Foods is the perfect match for you.  Feel free to contact Josefine Franklin Hansen at johap@arlafoods.com if you have any questions about the IT Graduate Programme. To find relevant information, please visit our site .    We have a purpose for Good  At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you?    BEWARE! RECRUITMENT FRAUD  It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails and fake recruitment campaigns on the internet from people purporting to work for Arla Foods. Learn more via this link . title: OPS Data Scientist
description: ×                  OPS Data Scientist         Applications are considered on a rolling basis         Multiple locations     Hybrid                I'm interested              Applications are considered on a rolling basis         Multiple locations     Hybrid        Job Description  Join our Operational Analytics team as a Data Scientist, where you'll play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data to uncover strategic insights and drive tangible business growth. As a key member of the Ops Data & Analytics team, consisting of three analysts and one data scientist, you'll be at the forefront of transforming raw data into intuitive insights.  This role primarily focuses on text analysis, speech-to-text analysis, and other predictive analysis, ensuring alignment with those who have a keen interest in these specific areas.  Utilize advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze extensive datasets, extracting actionable insights. Engage with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges, fostering collaborative efforts to develop data-driven solutions that optimize customer processes and enhance operational efficiency.  Main tasks and responsibilities:   Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques, with a primary focus on text analysis, speech-to-text analysis, and other predictive analysis.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges, developing data-driven solutions to optimize customer processes and drive operational efficiency.  Design and implement predictive models and algorithms for forecasting, anomaly detection, and decision-making.  Develop and maintain data pipelines, ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the data lifecycle.  Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to facilitate informed decision-making.  Stay updated on the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in data science and analytics.   Skills & Requirements   A bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.  Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, with experience in data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.  Solid understanding of statistical concepts and experience applying statistical modeling techniques.  Experience with machine learning algorithms, data mining, and predictive modeling.  Familiarity with databases and SQL for data extraction and manipulation.  Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently or as part of a team.  Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.   Experience:    Experience as a data scientist, data engineer, data specialist or data analyst.  A strong track record of building and deploying predictive and/or prescriptive models.  Proven programming and modelling expertise.  Experience with cloud platforms, such as AWS or Azure, is a plus.  Prior experience in customer analytics or process optimization is advantageous but not mandatory.   What we offer   An opportunity to work in a large, high-performing international company, in a dynamic environment that is constantly changing.  A corporate culture that is professional and dynamic, yet informal. Bureaucracy is kept to a minimum, as we expect our skilled employees to make long lasting and impactful decisions to shape our future.  Highly competent, dedicated, and friendly co-workers with strong collaboration across the Nordics.  Hybrid work environment (2-3 days remote work per week).  Emphasis on work-life balance.  Anticipated travel activity of 2-3 times per year, each trip lasting a few days.  Opportunity to work with the latest technologies in machine learning and AI.   This position can be in any of our Nordic locations in Helsinki, Hvidovre, Solna, Stavanger or Lysaker.  Are you interested?  If you are intrigued by this position and possess the right profile and mindset, please submit your application and CV via the link. Applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews will be planned as soon as a suitable candidate is identified.  If you have any questions about the position, you can contact Philip Aarup, Team Leader of OPS Data & Analytics.          Great Place to Work    We invest in you   Innovative and looking to the future   BeHealthy | Your health is important to us   Social events for all employees   Engaged colleagues   Dynamic work environment   Employee benefits and discounts   Competitive insurance and pension plans   We give back to society   Gode pensions- og forsikringsforhold   Vi investerer i din udvikling   Vi giver tilbage til samfundet   Medarbejderfordele og rabatter   Dedikeret kollegaer   Globale muligheder   Sociale arrangementer for alle medarbejdere   Innovativ og fremadtænkende virksomhed   Gode forsikrings- og pensjonsordninger   Engasjerte kolleger   Sosiale arrangement for alle ansatte   BeHealthy | Din helse er viktig for oss   Innovativt og fremtidsrettet selskap   Vi investerer i deg   Vi gir tilbake til samfunnet   Personalgoder og rabatter   Dynamisk arbeidsmiljø   Sociala evenemang för alla anställda   Dynamisk arbetsmiljö   Vi ger tillbaka till samhället   Konkurrenskraftiga pensioner & försäkringar   Innovation, förbättring och utveckling   Globala möjligheter   Friskvård - din hälsa är viktig för oss   Engagerade kollegor   Personalförmåner via Benify             About the company  We are a Nordic bank with more than 1,200 colleagues in Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland, and proud to be part of Banco Santander, one of the largest banks in the world with a solid history going back more than 160 years.  Our purpose is to help people and businesses prosper and we aim to be the best retail and commercial bank, earning the lasting loyalty of our people, customers, shareholders and communities - through simple, personal and fair banking.  In our organization we foster and value an engaged, challenging and passionate environment that provides opportunities for personal and professional growth. We operate in an ever changing environment, and believe the key to success is innovative involvement, a playful approach to active learning and continuous improvement in our daily work.  We are firmly committed to being a responsible bank in the way we operate, our culture, caring for our environment and giving back to society. Banco Santander is recognized as the most sustainable bank in the world following the publication of the Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) for 2019.  Read more about responsible banking on our global webpages.  Santander Consumer Bank is one of the largest Nordic banks providing loans and credits, credit cards, deposits and insurance to private customers. title: Data & Analytics Practice Lead
company: IBM Client Innovation Center Danmark ApS
description: Skip to content     Toggle Navigation IBM Careers English 简体中文 Français Français Canadien 日本語 Português Español IBM Careers  IBM Careers       English     简体中文     Français     Français Canadien     日本語     Português     Español               Job Details somesh 2023-11-17T19:24:48+00:00    669135BR    Data & Analytics Practice Lead     Multiple Locations See All   Copenhagen   Aarhus     Data & Analytics  Professional    Apply now  Data & Analytics Practice Lead     Multiple Locations See All   Copenhagen   Aarhus     Data & Analytics  Professional    Apply now  Introduction In this role, you’ll work in one of our IBM Consulting Client Innovation Centers, where we deliver deep technical and industry expertise to a wide range of public and private sector clients around the world.​ Our centers offer our clients locally based skills and technical expertise to drive innovation and adoption of new technology. Your Role and Responsibilities Vil du stå i spidsen for et voksende Data & Analytics-team og være konsulent hos én af vores store danske kunder? Som practice lead i Data & Analytics teamet i IBM Client Innovation Center Danmark sætter du den strategiske retning og står i spidsen for vores Data & Analytics-team bestående af ambitiøse Data Scientists, Data Engineers og BI-konsulenter fordelt på kontorer i København og Aarhus. Du vil agere som fagligt fyrtårn indenfor advanced analytics både i teamet og som konsulent, hvor der skabes innovative løsninger og mærkbare forretningsresultater gennem analyse og modellering af store datamængder. Hos Data & Analytics-teamet arbejder vi med de nyeste teknologier inden for machine- og deep learning, data engineering og advanced analytics generelt, og vi udvikler og implementerer løsninger for nogle af de største virksomheder i Norden.  Et ledelsesteam rig på sparring Som practice leder i IBM Client Innovation Center, der er leverancepartner til IBM Consulting, vil du indgå i vores ledelsesteam og referere direkte til vores centerleder. Vi er organiseret i 6 practices: Development, Test & Automation, UX & Design, Business Delivery, Agile og Data & Analytics. I ledelsesteamet arbejder vi bl.a. med leadership allies. Det betyder, at du på skift danner makkerpar med en kollega fra en anden practice, som du modtager sparring og coaching fra om ledelsesmæssige udfordringer.  Sæt retning og form fremtidens konsulenter Du kan se frem til en rolle med god variation og mulighed for fortsat at bruge dine kompetencer inden for rådgivning og stakeholder management, når du bl.a. bidrager med strategisk rådgivning og viden om AI til én af vores store danske kunder. Sideløbende får du som practice lead ansvaret for at inspirere og udvikle dit team, som består af data scientists, data engineers og BI-konsulenter, samt tiltrække nye talenter til practicen. Du får personaleansvar og bliver ansvarlig for dit teams projektallokeringer, og du bliver målt dels på dine egne, dels på teamets resultater. Vi forventer, at du kan sætte den professionelle retning for dit team, og at du aktivt tager stilling til vores positionering og kompetencer, så vores konsulenter bliver kendt som de dygtigste inden for Data & Analytics-området.  Kontinuerlig læring og balance i hverdagen Vi har fokus på work/life integration og tilbyder stor fleksibilitet i forhold til arbejdstid og hjemmearbejde. Derudover lægger vi stor vægt på kontinuerlig læring og kompetenceudvikling, og vi har skabt en social og nede-på-jorden kultur med fokus på teamet. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Data & Analytics-konsulent med lederambitioner Det er en fordel, hvis du har prøvet kræfter med personaleledelse, men det er ikke et krav, at du har haft en formel lederrolle. Med din erfaring som konsulent forstår du de udfordringer, som dine medarbejdere kan møde, og du kan coache og inspirere dem, så de bliver ved med at udvikle deres kompetencer.  Derudover forestiller vi os, at du:   har en stærk baggrund inden for data science og/eller data engineering  har 5+ års erfaring som konsulent  har evnerne til at drive ambitiøse og værdiskabende projekter med vores kunders behov i fokus  taler både dansk og engelsk, så du kan kommunikere med alle vores kunder  kan levere innovative data og analytics-løsninger, samt drive dem fra idé til produktion  har erfaring med professionel udvikling i python  har kendskab til software life-cycle gennem konkret erfaring inden for enten DevOps, MLOps eller DataOps  har erfaring med Cloud, Container teknologier, CI/CD og IaC   Vores ansættelsesproces Har du spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte centerleder Signe Birgitte Schmid på +45 41 20 11 46. Hos os behøver du ikke sende en ansøgning; upload dit CV og skriv så gerne et par linjer i dit CV om, hvad der har fået dig til at søge stillingen.  Vi ser frem til at modtage dit CV! Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise –  Want to know what it’s like to be an IBMer? Sorry, your browser doesn't support embedded videos. Transcript [ambient music] I built the computers and software for the Apollo missions, landing Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin on the moon. I invented the UPC barcode transforming the way retailers track and store inventory. Since the 1910s, I've advocated for the hiring of more employees with disabilities, decades before the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. [speaking in foreign language] I use artificial intelligence to provide solutions that streamline how businesses automate their practices. I advocate against racial inequality, committing to a change in conversation and design that lets everyone feel included. I ensure the distribution of vaccines from inception to injection using blockchain technology. [speaking in foreign language] I'm building the future of quantum computing to provide solutions to complex problems that not even supercomputers can solve. [bright upbeat music] I am IBM. What will I do next? [bright upbeat music] Pause Play % buffered 00:00 00:00 Unmute Mute Settings Captions Disabled Transcript Disabled Captions Go back to previous menu Disabled Deutsche DE English EN Español ES Français FR Italiano IT 日本語 JA Korean KO Polish PL Português PT ro RO Exit fullscreen Enter fullscreen Video length: 94 seconds 1:34 About Business Unit  About Business Unit  IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.  Your Life @ IBM  Your Life @ IBM  In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.  Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.  Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.  Are you ready to be an IBMer?   About IBM  About IBM  IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.  Other Relevant Job Details   Location Statement  IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.  Being You @ IBM  Being You @ IBM  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. title: Data scientist for image analysis of biomedical data
description: Create job agent    Available positions   Login My profile My profile                          Data scientist for image analysis of biomedical data   Do you have a passion for automated image analysis using AI and machine learning. AI has emerged as an important tool for studying complex disease endpoints. At Gubra we rely on advanced image analysis to extract quantitative information from large microscopy datasets. This is a fast-growing field, and we have a vacant position to advance and support our pipeline. So if you are motivated by working in a multi-disciplinary environment, this might be an exciting opportunity for you at Gubra.  You will be part of AI Technology that consists of highly passionate data scientists. The department develops smart and tailor-made solutions to understand and visualize biological problems in close collaboration with scientists spanning multiple disciplines, often with short yet realistic deadlines. Furthermore, our experts engage in scientific discussions, various data management and software development tasks. Gubra is an ambitious biotech company striving for excellence at all levels. We insist on doing things efficiently – and often differently - to reach the results we aim for. Our vision is to become leaders in the fight for a more sustainable and healthier world. We do that by facilitating the discovery of new medicines, and by acting and inspiring others to fight against the ongoing climate and biodiversity crisis.  You can work independently but understand that being part of a team is the way to success. You take ownership over your tasks and can transform complicated data to valuable interpretable results. You can explain your computational problem-solving and solutions to non-computational-science-experts to non-department colleagues and our customers. You have an eye for automation and validation of processes and constantly look to optimize tasks and steps that can be better solved by a computer than by humans.  The tasks include, but are not limited to:  Development and maintenance of our automated image analysis (2D and 3D) pipelines spanning raw data acquisition all the way to the final data packages for internal/external customers Establish QC and validation steps in our workflows to ensure high-quality data packages Support our CRO business with data analysis and scientific counselling and collaborate across multiple disciplines Facilitate communication between the AI Technology department and our sales department Take part in the daily scientific research, discussions, and presentations internally and externally  As a candidate for the job, you possess several of the qualifications below  A relevant master or Ph.D. degree Experience in processing and analysis of biomedical image data, using both classical and deep learning approaches Writing well-structured and readable code Can comfortably work in a Linux server environment Familiarity with statistics and common data science approaches Proficiency in version control in git, Github, Azure or similar tools Biological knowledge of e.g. brain, cardiac, liver, or kidney pathologies  As a person you are  Highly enthusiastic about data analysis and computational biology Detail-oriented and motivated by going the extra mile to deliver high-quality data Excited about new insights and data Keen to take on responsibility within your area of expertise Curious by nature, motivated by data and not afraid to challenge status quo Proactive and able to initiate, focus and deliver on tasks and projects Able to navigate and collaborate in an energetic and rapidly changing organization Appreciating being part of a collaborative team  Please apply no later than December 3, 2023 by uploading your motivated cover letter and resume on our website. We will be processing incoming applications continually. If you have any questions about the position, please contact Department Manager Casper Salinas at cgs@gubra.dk. About Gubra  Gubra is an ambitious and innovative biotech company striving for excellence at all levels. We insist on doing things efficiently – and often differently - to reach the results we aim for. Our vision is to become leaders in the fight for a more sustainable and healthier world. We do that by facilitating the discovery of new medicine, and by acting and inspiring others to fight against the ongoing climate and biodiversity crises. We have two primary areas of business: Preclinical contract research (CRO) services, and Proprietary early target and drug discovery programs. We are a biotech company delivering science to our partners and to our own research projects. We are active in the so-called pre-clinical space - before drugs are tested in humans - and generate our revenue by performing research for small and large pharma companies. Our focus is within the metabolic space (obesity, diabetes, NASH (Non-alcoholic steatohepatitis), and diabetic complications), where we specialize in in vivo pharmacology, peptide chemistry, molecular pharmacology, histology, stereology, imaging, NGS (next generation sequencing), bioinformatics and biomarker assays. We work with some of the most interesting and loyal partners and customers from across the world within big pharma, biotech, and academia. Through a constant focus on high quality, scientific excellence, speed, and solid teamwork we have established ourselves as a highly professional and competent partner in the market. People are our greatest asset, and our team consists of +210 employees all located in Hørsholm, Denmark. The mix of people from different cultures and educational backgrounds combined with our entrepreneurial mindset have greatly impacted our working environment, which is characterized by intensive drive, scientific curiosity, and teamwork – we join forces!  Apply   Share in your network                Deadline:  03/12/2023     Contact person:    Casper Gravesen Gravesen Salinas  Department Manager       Mail:    cgs@gubra.dk       Job area:  AI Technology    Employment terms:  Full time                                   Powered by Emply          Login  Have you applied for a job or created a job agent? title: PhD scholarship in Computer Vision with Deep Learning for Human-Machine Collaboration – DTU Compute
description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 PhD scholarship in Computer Vision with Deep Learning for Human-Machine Collaboration – DTU Compute        Kgs. Lyngby, Denmark                    Trending                                        Jobbeskrivelse   Do you want to advance the state-of-the-art research in computer vision systems using human-machine collaboration? The Technical University of Denmark (DTU) invites you to apply for a fully funded 3-year PhD position. The position is funded by the Sapere Aude: DFF-Starting grant . The position is offered at DTU, in the Department of Computer Science and Applied Mathematics, at the Visual Computing Group , and will work closely with researchers from the Pioneer Centre for AI . Project description Learning visual recognition models requires huge amounts of data, especially when relying on data-hungry deep neural networks. These data need to be manually and passively annotated by humans. This labeling procedure is one of the most important steps in a machine learning pipeline and is tedious, expensive, and susceptible to noise leading to erroneous labels. We aim to establish a deeper human-machine collaboration for all stages of the learning pipeline via multimodal labeling and learning. The goal of this project is to leverage information from different modalities that naturally occur near web images to assist the image annotation.  You will develop state-of-the-art multimodal models for self-supervision with human-in-the-loop text supervision. This PhD project will be supervised by Associate Professor (DTU). Responsibilities During the PhD program, you will:   Work with state-of-the-art deep learning computer vision models.  Develop state-of-the-art models for human-machine collaboration in computer vision.  Publish scientific papers and present research results in top computer vision conferences (CVPR, ECCV, ICCV).  Spend a few months during the PhD program abroad.  Work as a teaching assistant in courses at DTU.   Qualifications To succeed in this position, you should have the following required skills:   A master’s degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar in Computer Science, Informatics, Computer Engineering, Applied Mathematics or equivalent.  Proven experience in Python.  Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks.  High level of motivation and innovation.  Experience in computer vision is a plus.   Excellent written and communication skills in English. Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education . Assessment The assessment of the applicants will be made by Associate Professor Dimitrios Papadopoulos . We offer DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility. Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years; start in Spring or Summer 2024. You can read more about career paths at DTU here . Further information  If you have questions, you are very welcome to contact Associate Professor Dimitrios Papadopoulos at dimp@dtu.dk . If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar “ PhD relocation to Denmark and startup “Zoom” seminar ” for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU. Application procedure Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 2 January 2024  (23:59 Danish time) . Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae (CV)  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale   Incomplete applications will not be considered. You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it. Applications received after the deadline will not be considered. All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply. DTU Compute DTU Compute is a unique and internationally recognized academic department with 385 employees and 11 research sections spanning the science disciplines mathematics, statistics, computer science, and engineering. We conduct research, teaching and innovation of high international standard – producing new knowledge and technology-based solutions to societal challenges. We have a long-term involvement in applied and interdisciplinary research, big data and data science, artificial intelligence (AI), internet of things (IoT), smart and secure societies, smart manufacturing, and life science. At DTU Compute we believe in a diverse workplace with a flexible work-life balance. Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                  Senior Software Engineer   Cloud Services   |   Backend   |   Infrastructure   |   Data Science   |   Machine Learning  We are looking for a senior software engineer that can work alongside our data scientists to develop cloud-based analytics and machine learning solutions for the food production industry world-wide.  Scio+ is part of the SKOV A/S group of companies and we are the competence center for data-driven and vision-based solutions for the food production industry within the livestock segment. We provide production insights and predictions by applying machine learning techniques to discrete data and vision data from farm production sites. These innovative solutions focus on bringing added value to the production by optimizing processes, reducing cost and not least by reducing environmental footprint and improving animal welfare.  Working in Scio+  You will be a member of an international, skilled, highly motivated and self-driven team of software developers and data scientists spanning different educational backgrounds and competences. We do weekly sprint-like iterations, focusing our work on what adds value to our customers. We work as a DevOps teams meaning that we are responsible for developing, running and maintain our services.  We expect you to be passionate about development infrastructure backend and deployment of machine learning solutions. We value individuals who have an open and positive attitude towards colleagues, are ambitious about their work, and what we can achieve together.  You will be working together with colleagues in other development teams which are located globally in our regional offices.  What profile are we looking for?   You have a master's or PhD degree in computer science, engineering or in a related field  You are an experienced software developer (3-5 years+) that understand the challenges in designing and implementing and running cloud-based services  You have experience in delivering solutions using continuous integration and continuous delivery. It is beneficial if you have experience with continuous training of ML models  You have experience in Java, and it is a plus if you know .Net and Python.  You have experience with Azure or other cloud platforms like AWS or GCP  You have experience with Event-Streaming Platforms such as Apache Kafka or Azure Eventhub  You care about agile development processes and continuously improving velocity and applications  You like to foster the agile mindset within the group  You know the importance of data security  You are a great team player with a willingness to take responsibility in completing the different tasks for us to reach our goals together  You are flexible when it comes to tasks and able to keep an overview of multiple tasks in a sometimes hectic environment   What would you actually be doing?   Support, improve and maintain our current cloud infrastructure backend  Building reliable and secure data collection systems for experimentations and for production-ready systems  Create transparency on the health and the performance of cloud infrastructure for solutions in production and drive optimizations on operation and costs  Participate in chapter-work with other development teams in our group  Impact new products development on the infrastructure side   Join us  We offer a flexible work arrangement with respect for a healthy work–life balance for all employees, and a unique opportunity to make your impact on the organization as it grows together with you. We offer you to join social activities with your colleagues, also here we hope you might have a great idea for some activities.  Want to know more?  Please contact Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown, phone +45 88 74 11 43 or by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com  Apply for the job  We are assessing applications on an ongoing basis, so please send your cover letter, CV and relevant attachments as soon as possible to Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com     Scio+ is an ambitious young company working at the forefront of data science in the food production sector. Our vision is to be a world class partner in data driven livestock yield optimization and our mission is to optimize livestock food production yield across the entire value chain by providing reliable data driven insights.        Apply for position  Application due: 29/12/2023  Workplace: Denmark  Position category: Research & Development        Share/Print    Questions regarding the position        Simon Binderup Johansen   Business Development Director  sij@skov.dk  +4572175588                                                                                ShareThis Copy and Paste

description:

Vendors  Youtube, Linkedin      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                Career menu       Start    Departments    People    Jobs      Employee  Log in   WS Audiology  WS Audiology  WS Audiology APAC  WS Audiology Americas  WS Audiology EMEA   Candidate  Log in to Connect       WS Audiology EMEA             Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail            Research & Development  ·  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark   Data Engineer - Machine Learning     Apply now            Join us in the newly established role and utilize your skills to advance the hearing aid industry with AI-based innovations. Does this sounds wonderful to you? Then have a look. Who we are At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services. Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world. With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes. Sounds wonderful? Then keep on reading The Team To deliver on our purpose to make wonderful sound part of everyone’s life, we are strengthening our capabilities with an additional, passionate, and purpose-driven team player in our AI Fitting Accelerator. This is a newly established unit, that is inspired by the opportunity to advance the hearing aid industry with AI-based innovations. You will get to learn a bit more about the innovations, that you will be working on, further along in the recruitment process. As it is a self-sustaining unit, it will handle the entire innovation cycle, from idea generation, through prototyping and testing, to product delivery. To do so, the team will foster a creative spirit while being on the forefront of newest technologies. You will be part of a team with an informal culture and consisting of skilled and dedicated individuals lifting together. The Role As our new Data Engineer , you will be building the bridge between our centralized data team (that are responsible for ingesting production data from various sources into a central data lake), and the AI Fitting Accelerator, by developing and maintaining a data eco-system that is the foundation of our machine learning projects. Main responsibilities and tasks e.g.  Ingesting production data, understanding the underlying hearing aid data domain, and ensuring development of a data model architecture that exposes the data in an interpretable way ready for data analysts, data scientists and other data consumers.  Collaborating with data scientists on machine learning projects by delivering curated datasets that are ready for predictive modelling, as well as seeking out opportunities where a data-centric approach can support move the project forward.  Building core infrastructure for data-driven products in collaboration with software and machine learning engineers.  About You To be successful in the role as our new Data Engineer you recognize that having quality data requires an understanding of where and how the data is generated, and thus what real-world process it describes. Therefore, you enjoy interacting with subject matter experts to understand the reality in the data you provide. You are a team player who seeks design feedback and engage in constructive discussions with your fellow colleagues. To summarize, we are hoping to see the following qualifications in you:  Master’s Degree within Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field  Python machine learning/data science stack (such as Torch, Tensorflow, scikit-learn, ClearML, etc.)  Distributed data processing frameworks (such as Databricks, Spark, Hadoop, etc.)  Cloud development and deployment (we use Microsoft Azure)  As person we expect you to be creative, have attention to detail, and a collaborative attitude that you see as a part of what defines you. You can work with a range of programming languages and tools, depending on the project requirements. You have a diverse computer science foundation that enables you to learn and apply new skills as needed. The corporate language is English, so you need to have professional proficiency in English both verbally and in writing. What we would like to offer you The working environment at WS Audiology is informal with helpful and skilled colleagues. Our values focus on teamwork across functions, pioneering as well as having the passion to make an impact. So, if you can see yourself in those values, you will fit right in. The benefits we can offer include an advantageous pension scheme with health insurance, sports and arts club as well as good canteen facilities. Our Danish headquarter, is a CO2 friendly and modern facility with beautiful surroundings close to Allerød north of Copenhagen, Denmark.  Sounds wonderful? Join us Please submit your CV as soon as possible. We will screen and invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, but the latest deadline is the 1st of December 2023 . In case you have any questions, you are more than welcome to contact Caspar Bang Jespersen at caspar.jespersen@wsa.com WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.       Department   Research & Development   Role  Global Innovation and Intellectual Property  Locations  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark  Employment type  Full-time                  Contact  Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen  Talent Acquisition Partner - EMEA
