Få den bedste brugeroplevelse med hurtigere hastighed, sikkerhed og privatliv ved at bruge den nyeste version af Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari eller Opera.   ×                                          Head of Artificial Intelligence – kom og stå for udviklingen af den nyeste teknologi i DSB!    Kunne du tænke dig at   lede et team af dygtige, veluddannede og entusiastiske specialister inden for AI, ML og Big Data?  sætte retningen for en endnu bedre udnyttelse af teknologien og leverancerne på området?  nudge os til at udbrede og øge Artificial Intelligence i DSB?   Vi har siden 2016 udviklet og implementeret projekter som dynamisk prissætning af vores billetprodukter, pladsanvisning i S-togene, automatisk detektering af graffiti på togene, udrulning af chatGPT-løsninger til fri afbenyttelse af alt DSB-personale og meget mere.  Vi har derigennem øget den personlige sikkerhed for vores personale, optimeret processerne og forbedret kundetilfredsheden.  Velkommen til Artificial Intelligence!  I DSB har vi valgt at skalere vores arbejde med Artificial Intelligence for at sikre den bedst mulige kundeoplevelse og de mest effektive processer i dagligdagen.  I øjeblikket er vi otte medarbejdere med ekspertise inden for machine learning, computer vision, data science, Generative AI, softwareudvikling, løsningsarkitektur og forretningsanalyse.  Vi arbejder med det meste af Azure Tech Stacken og er i proces med at konsolidere data til vores nye Data Lakehouse.  Til AI & ML anvender vi Databricks, MLflow, Azure Data Factory, Azure Event Hubs, IoT Hub og Solace.  Vi er en meget efterspurgt ressource, og vi skal udvide afdelingen.  Vi tror på, at kombinationen af data, automatisering og menneskelig indsigt kan skabe helt særlige resultater for vores passagerer.  TrAIn – hvad er det?  Vi har netop igangsat programmet TrAIn, der både skal udvikle AI use cases og udrulle Generative AI i hele DSB.  Sammen med de bedste eksterne partnere vil vi gentænke DSB’s kerneprocesser og strategi ved brug af AI for at forbedre kundeoplevelsen og togenes punktlighed.  TrAIn-programmet er et billede på alt det, vi vil på AI-fronten. Og direktionen er med.  Vi starter med vores trafikinformation.  Når togene er forsinkede, vil vi bruge big data fra togenes status og placering samt mønstergenkendelse og forudsigelser af den daglige togdrift.  Det vil gøre os i stand til at give kunderne en hurtigere, konsistent og mere personlig trafikinformation.  Som Head of AI får du en betydningsfuld rolle i TrAIn.  Hvad går jobbet ellers ud på?  Din fornemste opgave bliver at bygge, udvikle og opjustere vores indsatser indenfor AI på tværs af DSB.  Over for teamet vil du   Lede, sparre, skabe gode rammer og bane vejen for en professionel indsats  Rekruttere nye dygtige kollegaer    Samarbejdet med andre interessenter handler om at   Sørge for, at forretningens behov bliver omsat til udvikling af tekniske løsninger, der skaber resultater for alle parter  Formidle budskaber til mange målgrupper som IT-specialister, direktion, administrativt og kørende personale  Styre og samarbejde med eksterne leverandører i større strategiske implementeringer    I forhold til teknologien er det din opgave at   Sikre, at vi er på forkant med de muligheder, ny teknologi giver os  Udvikle og udrulle AI-strategi i DSB samt tage de rette initiativer, så vi overholder governance, regulering og etiske krav på området   Tech savvy & erfaren IT-leder – er det dig?  Vi forestiller os, at du er en entusiast inden for udvikling af ML/AI og interaktionen mellem teknologi og mennesker. Du kan begejstres over teknologiske trends og muligheder på feltet.  Du har erfaring med   udrulning af AI eller andre transformative programmer i en stor organisation  at opbygge et eller flere leveranceteams på dataområdet  personaleledelse inden for udvikling af AI og machine learning   Du kommunikerer lige så godt på engelsk som dansk, da vores interne sprog i IT er engelsk, og flere i teamet taler primært engelsk.  Hvad tilbyder DSB?  Nogle af vores personalegoder er   Gratis transport med DSB  Fleksible arbejdstider og mulighed for hjemmearbejde et par dage om ugen  Træning i DSB’s eget fitnesscenter og PureGym  Pension og sundhedsforsikring  Frokostordning og mulighed for at købe mad med hjem   Læs mere her om personalegoder og om DSB som arbejdsplads .  Søg nu  Ansøgningsfristen er d. 17. december 2023.   Vi evaluerer og gennemfører samtaler løbende, så skynd dig at søge.  Upload dit materiale og evt. en ansøgningsvideo på vores jobportal.  Har du spørgsmål, så ringer du bare til Søren Friis, som er Director for BI, Analytics & Office of the CIO på tlf. 2468 8996.  #LI-Hybrid #LI-BS1       I DSB bliver du en del af en selvstændig offentlig virksomhed, der investerer milliarder i nye elektriske tog, trygge stationer og attraktive produkter og services. Vi er fælles om viljen til at give vores kunder den bedste rejseoplevelse og til at skabe et grønnere og mere sammenhængende Danmark.  Hos os vil du opleve, at der er gode karrieremuligheder med balance mellem arbejde og fritid. Alle er velkomne - uanset køn, etnisk baggrund, handicap, alder, seksuel orientering og religion.  - Plads til alle på rejsen mod det bæredygtige -             Application due 17-12-2023   Workplace Telegade 2, Taastrup, Danmark  Homepage dsb.dk        Contact  [Project.ContactPerson1.ProfileImage-]   Søren Friis Holm  Afdelingschef        24688996     [Project.ContactPerson2.ProfileImage-]               [Project.ContactPerson3.ProfileImage-]               [Project.ContactPerson4.ProfileImage-]                 Flere ledige stillinger                                            ShareThis Copy and Paste

Senior Signal Processing Specialist           Application Deadline:  Ongoing          Workplace:  Hybrid Position          Location:    Bjerringbro, DK, 8850             Contract Type:  Full-Time          Working Hours:  37          Employment Type:  Regular                Are you ready to play a vital role in Grundfos’s digital journey and to contribute in solving the world’s water and climate challenges? And do you have a background in signal processing and algorithm development?    Grundfos has a huge focus on sensor solutions as a mean to make intelligent pumps that can provide customers with valuable data and insights regarding their operation, their system, and the pump itself.    The position is in the Technology Innovation sensor department where you will join a team of nine engineers with backgrounds withing electronics, physics, and signal processing. The department is responsible for developing new technologies regarding sensors and sensor integration from idea phase to a solution ready for commercial scaling. Signal processing plays a crucial role both in the process of refining and enriching sensor signals, but also when sensor signals are utilized to conclude on health conditions and performance of pump and system.    “ On an interpersonal level, the department is defined by an informal atmosphere where cooperation, curiosity, and thoroughness are in high regard. Technical excellence and customer centricity is some of our core values, and our decisions are guided by a fact-based approach ” explains Michael.    What is the job about?  As our new signal processing specialist, you will be responsible for signal processing solutions regarding sensor activities in our technology projects. You will also provide specialist support to product development projects and stakeholders across the value chain.    This includes:  ·         Develop algorithms using various signal processing techniques ranging from classical frequency analysis over statistics, mathematical modelling to machine learning  ·         Develop algorithms for sensor such as accelerometers, coil sensors, pressure and flow sensors or internal pump parameters  ·         Developing predictive maintenance algorithms that will conclude on pump health and performance  ·         Hands-on work with pumps and sensors in test laboratories  ·         Investigating customer value by implementing product demonstrators in real application.    “ Together with colleagues in the project it is your job to deliver a complete solution consisting of hardware, software, and integration with the pump. One of your tasks will be to act as a bridge between the electronics and the algorithms while maintaining a customer focus ” says Michael.    What do you need to apply?  We imagine that you have a technical background within signal processing on master or PhD level – preferable in combination with electronics, physics, mechanics, or acoustics. You have 3+ years of work experience withing signal processing. We expect you to have a solid and broad signal processing toolbox including frequency analysis, classical filtering techniques, mathematical modelling, and statistics.    Furthermore, you:    ·         Might have practical experience working with sensors or hardware  ·         Have experience with Python or at least a similar programming language  ·         Speak and write English fluently.    “ On a personal level, you are enjoy working together with close colleagues and also colleagues in other parts of the organisation on many different levels. Finally, it is essential that you have the curiosity and willingness to continuously learn and build your knowledge and skills. ” finishes Michael.    What’s in it for you?  Whether it’s developing leadership skills or advancing your expertise even further, we’ll support you with continuous learning and development opportunities, to help discuss and steer your long-term Grundfos career path. You’ll be welcomed from day one into an inclusive, trusting environment guided by six core values .     In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:  ·         If you’ll be working from your home office, we’ll make sure you are well equipped with a good workstation. However, you are always welcome to our offices where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues  ·         On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 days’ additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice  ·         Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes  ·         Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development  ·         Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly    Do you want to know more?   If you have questions or would like to know more about this position, please contact hiring manager Michael R.S. Hansen  at mrshansen@ grundfos.com .    If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking “Apply”.    To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube , and to get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people     We look forward to hearing from you.           About Grundfos  Grundfos is one of the world’s leading water technology companies with more than 19.000 employees in 60+ countries all over the world. Our skills commit us to pioneering solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do, as we believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.  An inclusive team If you like the look of this job and know you can bring your skills to contribute to our purpose, please apply. We need and welcome professional people from all corners – however you identify and whatever your background is. title: DTU Tenure Track Researcher in Machine Learning in Fisheries Technology - DTU Aqua
description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                     Esc                                 DTU Tenure Track Researcher in Machine Learning in Fisheries Technology - DTU Aqua        Hirtshals, Denmark                     Vær den første til at søge                                       Jobbeskrivelse   You will join the Section for Fisheries Technology at DTU Aqua in Hirtshals. The section has 19 employees and focuses on the technological development of fishing gears, techniques and methods that can contribute to promoting economic and environmental sustainability in the fishing industry, and that can support society's need to regulate fishing. The section is internationally recognized and has a strong collaborative network within the development of advanced analytics. Learn more about the Section at https://www.aqua.dtu.dk/fisheries-technology-section  Responsibilities and qualifications In this role, you will join an internationally recognised multidisciplinary team to develop new technologies and advanced analytics such as deep learning methods for the analysis of images and videos for species identification and automated catch registration to advance fisheries. The team is developing fish detection and species identification algorithms, with the goal of implementing the software in commercial fisheries. Your role will be to further this development by contributing with a strong background in computer vision, machine learning, quantitative analysis and programming. You will collaborate with nearby colleagues and strengthen existing collaborations with other DTU institutes while also establishing new academic and industrial partnerships. Your primary tasks will be to:   Develop supervised, semi-supervised and/or unsupervised methods, as well as robust learning methods to detect, classify, and segment fish species in videos;  Manage and automate the collection and labelling of new datasets;  Deliver an error rate analysis of the fish detection and species recognition algorithms;  Produce high quality scientific papers suitable for publication in quality journals;  Prepare conference papers and present those at conferences;  Contribute to the development of innovative concepts and ideas for further research;  Participate in national and international projects through the generation of new ideas in collaboration with end users;   In the assessment of the candidates, particular consideration will be given to:   A strong track record in the development and application of computer vision algorithms, machine learning and automation, and the ability to understand and develop mathematically-founded machine learning algorithms for video analyses;  Highly experienced in developing and evaluating machine learning models;  A history of publishing in peer reviewed journals and/or authorship of scientific papers, reports, grant applications or patents;  Proficiency in Python, C++ or equivalent programming languages;  High level written and oral communication skills, including the presentation of research outcomes at national and international conferences.   You must contribute to the teaching of courses. DTU employs two working languages: Danish and English. You are expected to be fluent in at least one of these languages, and in time are expected to master both.  As formal qualification you must hold a PhD degree (or equivalent) as well as a minimum of 2 years research experience after the PhD.  You will be assessed against the responsibilities and qualifications stated above and the following general criteria:   Research experience  Experience and quality of teaching  Research vision and potential  International impact and experience  Societal impact  Innovativeness, including commercialization and collaboration with industry  Leadership, collaboration, and interdisciplinary skills  Communication skills   Salary and terms of employment The position is a full-time position and start date is as early as feasible. The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union.  The position is part of DTU’s Tenure Track program. Read more about the program and the recruitment process here .  You can read more about career paths at DTU here .  Further information Further information may be obtained from Head of Section for Fisheries Technology Jordan Feekings, +45 24895821; email: jpfe@aqua.dtu.dk  You can read more about DTU Aqua at www.aqua.dtu.dk  If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark .  Application procedure Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 12 December 2023 (23:59 Danish time).  Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file. The file must include:   Application (cover letter)  Vision for teaching and research for the tenure track period  CV including employment history, list of publications, H-index and ORCID (see http://orcid.org/ )  Teaching portfolio including documentation of teaching experience  Academic Diplomas (MSc/PhD)   Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.  About DTU Aqua, Technical University of Denmark DTU Aqua provides research, advice, innovation and education at the highest international level within the sustainable exploitation of living marine and freshwater resources, the biology of aquatic organisms, and the dynamics of ecosystems as well as their integration in ecosystem-based management. DTU Aqua has 350 employees, of whom a third are scientific staff. The other employees are assistant biologists, laboratory technicians, administrative staff, ship’s crew etc. In addition, the institute has a number of scientific and administrative support functions, including the research vessels DANA and HAVFISKEN. DTU Aqua has locations in Lyngby, Hirtshals, Nykøbing Mors, and Silkeborg.  Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Big Data Engineer           Application Deadline:            Workplace:  Hybrid Position          Location:    Bjerringbro, DK, 8850             Contract Type:  Full-Time          Working Hours:  37          Employment Type:  Regular                This is a fantastic opportunity for a junior person to learn and grow.  We have a startup mindset in this department, with deep knowledge in cloud, snowflake and Ml learning and AI application development. We are customer minded and are building critical function/capability for the future of Grundfos digital products.    What is the job about?  As a Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in building and evolving our data platform to drive advanced digital capabilities for our future product s.  You will be at the forefront of designing and developing robust data models  and pipelines , collaborating closely with Data Scientist s , Data Analysts and Application development teams  to ensure smooth data service .     Your main responsibilities :   Data Model and Pipeline:    Design and implement data ingestion and delivery service towards data providers and consumers, such as IoT data from pumps/systems, asset master data, weather forecasts, ML models, application teams, dashboards, data scientists and data analysts etc.   Design and implement robust and efficient data model and ETL pipeline to support advance analytics, machine learning and application data service etc.       Infrastructure and Deployment:    Improving data platform infrastructure and pipeline deployments using Git, IaC, CICD etc   Advocating team collaboration and knowledge sharing through pull request, peer reviews   Implement data governance and security measure to ensure data integrity, privacy and compliance with relevant regulations   Facilitate self-service analytics in application and technology teams by utilizing data platform infrastructure, tooling, deployment capabilities and sharing data engineering best practice.       Collaboration and Communication:    Collaborate with data scientists, technology SMEs, data analysts, software engineers etc to understand data service requirements and integrate them into the DataOps practice.   Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth handoffs and seamless collaboration.      Your background  We imagine that you have:   Master or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar   Experience with SQL and ETL using snowflake or similar   Data ingestion and delivery experience using Azure Data Factory, Azure eventhub, kafka, API, and object store, json, protobuf, avro etc., Azure or AWS certifications are highly desirable   Exposure to large scale data projects or operations with industry IoT, time series, asset master,  digital twin, ML workload in cloud or edge.   Data modeling experience such as Kimball and Data Valut 2.0   Solid software development experience in a team setup using git, CICD, Azure Devops or similar   Solid experience in Python, good exposure to shell script, docker, IaC(such as Bicep, terraform or pulumi), YAML      What’s in it for you?   What are your goals? Here at Grundfos it’s our mission to help you develop and fulfil your ambitions, both career and personal. We are guided by our six core values , and you’ll find that your fresh ideas will be welcomed and make a difference in everything from local to large-scale global projects. You’ll encounter colleagues from all over the world both as part of your daily work, supporting and all the while broadening each other’s cultural horizons.    In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:   Flexible working hours; home office possibility and equipment; up to 3 days’ paid leave for volunteering  Annual bonuses, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes, engaging team buildings   Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly  Long-term career development with regular dialogue, as well as continuous learning and development opportunities.     Do you want to learn more?  If you have questions or would like to know more about this position , please contact Head of UX UI Design Platform, Dripta Guha Roy at +4553194745    If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking “Apply”.    To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube , and t o get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out  Meet our people    We look forward to hearing from you.              About Grundfos  Grundfos is one of the world’s leading water technology companies with more than 19.000 employees in 60+ countries all over the world. Our skills commit us to pioneering solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do, as we believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.  An inclusive team If you like the look of this job and know you can bring your skills to contribute to our purpose, please apply. We need and welcome professional people from all corners – however you identify and whatever your background is.           Apply now »    Apply now    Apply Now        Start applying with LinkedIn                  Start           Please wait... title: DSP Engineer for tools and test development
description: Apply                          DSP Engineer for tools and test development  Smørum            Would you like to be at the forefront of the latest audio technology and make a difference for hearing impaired people worldwide? Can you see yourself as part of a team that shapes the future for audiological solutions within hearing aids? Then we might have an exciting career opportunity for you!  Welcome to team Digital Signal Processing  You will join our committed and highly skilled DSP Team, which is part of the Audiological Solutions group within R&D. We are innovators in our business and develop advanced audiological solutions for our future hearing aids. We are working with new state-of-the-art technologies within signal processing and machine learning.  “ We are a group of experienced DSP engineers waiting to welcome you. You will join a team with a high technical knowledge level, maybe some of the best at what we do, so this is really a place where you can exchange knowledge and learn something .” says your new manager, Erik Lund, and continues “ And innovation means everything to us, so your ideas and inputs are really appreciated. Besides that, we have a fantastic working environment with a lot of flexibility and a low hierarchy .”  We work in an agile setup, and in your daily work, you will be part of a scrum team with 8-10 team members with different competencies and backgrounds, where you work together to enhance audio processing and improve hearing aid functionality.  Make a difference in a great working environment.  You will be working in a growing international company, where there is rich opportunity for professional and personal development and plenty of new learnings. You will be part of an environment built on trust and openness. We all aim for an open and inclusive way of working where sharing knowledge and ideas are highly valued.  “ The role is central in supporting the team’s progress and development, where your focus will be on tools and test development .” says Erik and continues “ It’s a great way to really get to know your way around DSP and learn from the best .”  You will develop build/test framework for automatic tests used in the DSP area and develop audio/signal processing tools for Hearing Solutions. You will also contribute to tools roadmap in close collaboration with architects and other stakeholders.  In addition to this, you will:   Be point of contact for Continuous Integration related matters.  Build bridge between Feature Teams and Continuous Integration team.  Idea generation and innovation projects for new tools and signal processing.  Prototyping of new concepts.   We recognize that to bring energy and inspiration to work, you need to re-energize and spend time with family, friends, and hobbies in a healthy work life balance. We therefore offer the flexibility to work from home.  Tools for signal processing is your thing!  You hold a degree in engineering with a background in signal processing, computer science or similar. You have some experience with simulation tools and test automation within the DSP domain. In addition, you can probably tick off many of the following competencies:   Experience with Python, Matlab and GIT  Experience from test automation development  Knowledge of best practices with software development  Familiar with Windows or Linux environments for development.   We work with TeamCity and Simulink, so if you don’t already know them, you should be willing to dive into them.  As a person, you would describe yourself as someone, who works well within teams and likes technical challenges. You possess good communication skills, both orally and in writing and appear to be systematic, creative, and investigative. You are focused and motivated with a supporting mentally. You are motivated by dealing with numerous stakeholders and collaborating closely with your team colleagues.  Want to join the team?  Please send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 7th of December 2023 , as we are screening applications on a continuous basis. Please note that we only accept application through our online recruitment system.  If you would like to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Senior Manager, Erik Lund via e-mail: erlu@demant.com .  We are curious to meet you!  At Demant we value diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) and we are committed to creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of ethnic background, personality, age, gender, and education. Diversity is part of our cultural DNA. Women in STEM areas are particularly encouraged to apply, as Demant supports United Nations Sustainable Development Goal 5 on gender equality.        Read more                             Mirjana Adnadjevic – DSP Specialist  “At Oticon we do beautiful engineering that brings music to people. How cool is that!”             Anders Erik Petersen - Specialist, PCB & Electronics  “I have close relations to my colleagues, and together we develop products that truly help people”             Kajsa Angesten - Senior CRM Marketing Manager  “At Oticon I contribute to making a life-changing difference for people with a hearing loss. That is worth fighting for”                         4 af 5 stjerner   112 of Oticon´s employees have rated Oticon on Jobindex          Meet our employees                 Employee benefits    Working at Oticon    Graduate progamme    Student jobs          Read more     Employee benefits   Oticon is a workplace comprised of many people with various backgrounds. Needs and desires vary from person to person, which is why we offer a large range of employee benefits suited to the individual. We continuously work to optimise our benefits in order to provide our employees with attractive programmes and offerings.  Oticon offers an array of benefits including a business travel card for public transportation, employee broadband, attractive and flexible pension schemes, education support, and a wide range of discounts on everything from fitness to car repair. Our list of benefits is continually updated.            Read more     Working at Oticon   Oticon is part of the Demant Group – one of the largest hearing healthcare companies in the world. This opens up an exciting world of opportunities when you join us.  We believe that innovation is the cornerstone of our success, and we encourage of our employees to think out of the box, focus on teamwork, and continuously sharpen both professional and personal competencies.            Read more     Graduate progamme   Join our 2-year programme and get a unique opportunity to develop your personal and professional skills. Be part of our mission to create life-changing differences through hearing healthcare to millions of people worldwide!  The Graduate Programme at Demant offers you a unique opportunity to develop your personal and professional skills. You will join us in creating life-changing differences through hearing health to millions of people worldwide.            Read more     Student jobs   Oticon has approximately +70 student assistants working in various parts of our organisation. A student job is your opportunity to test out your theoretical knowledge obtained in your studies and put it to use in "real-life" projects. Student jobs also offer you an excellent entry point to permanent employment after graduation.  We consider our student assistants to be an important part of our business, because they contribute new knowledge, energy, and alternative perspectives. Look under Positions to see if we are advertising your dream student job. You are also always welcome to join us on LinkedIn and become part of our network.                   The recruiting process  At Oticon we strive to make the hiring process a positive experience for everyone involved. Below you can see about the individual steps that you as an applicant can expect to undergo throughout the process.           Writing a good job application  Your application provides an initial impression of you as a person; it not only describes your professional qualifications and experience, but it also reflects your personal qualities.      Interviews  An interview process typically includes two interviews. The first interview is attended by one of our talent acquisition consultant and either a personnel manager, project manager or employee who knows your prospective job area well. The second interview always involves the personnel manager and the recruiting specialist.      Starting work at Oticon  It is very important to us that you get a good start at Oticon. And it is also important to us that as a new employee, you gain a broad understanding of our company and its culture as quickly as possible. Therefore we have designed a mentor programme and introduction programme to help you settle into your new position.       Read more               2 open positions  Oticon offers the possibility of working within a wide range of professional areas. Here you can view all open positions. Indrykket:                                 About us  500 million people worldwide suffer from hearing loss. It is Oticon's ambition that our customers - hearing clinics throughout the world - prefer to use our products for people with impaired hearing. Oticon is one of the two largest companies in the industry, and in Denmark, all 1,400 employees, with passion, dedication and professional expertise, develop some of the most innovative hearing aids in the world.  Oticon is an international growing company, and 98% of Group revenues is generated outside Denmark. title: Senior IoT Specialist
description:
Ansøg nu                                                 Senior IoT Specialist        Hørsholm            Are you driven by innovation and the possibilities of Internet of Things technology in driving sustainability? Are you well-versed in IoT solution development, with a solid grasp of hardware, firmware, and sensor technologies as well as cyber security requirements and technologies at the product and system level?    If you are ready to translate your expertise into advising prospective clients on harnessing the full potential of IoT solutions, we invite you to consider the role of IoT Senior Specialist!   At FORCE Technology, we are undergoing a transformative journey, pivoting towards enhanced business orientation, digitalization, and sustainability, all while prioritizing our clients' needs. We cater to thousands of companies worldwide across diverse industries, and with your prowess, we aim to expand our reach and offerings.  About the role and key responsibilities  As a Senior IoT Specialist in the department for Digital and Sustainable Innovation at FORCE Technology, you will be an integral part of a dynamic team dedicated to digital innovation research, development, and commercial consultancy.  Among our twenty-five highly skilled specialists and consultants in areas such as data and computer science, data analytics and machine learning, wireless communication, sensor technology, digital production as well as design and business innovation, you will contribute with your deep-seated knowledge of electronics and firmware design, and implementation, and digital technology at large.  Combined with your broad grasp of sensor technology, wireless communication, and cyber security you will apply these skills when seeking out digital solutions, advising, and innovating in the areas of production optimization, sustainable business development, and smart city applications. Our overarching mission is to shape a safer, more sustainable future for all stakeholders.  Your key responsibilities include:    Strategic Consultancy:   Guiding companies in selecting optimal and secure IoT solutions tailored to their digital and sensor application needs.  Conducting technology scouting and benchmarking.  Collaborating with clients to define solution and product requirements.  Collaborating with IoT solution suppliers to ensure high-quality, purpose aligned IoT solutions.   Applied Research Projects:   Engaging in collaborative applied research initiatives and projects with universities, research organizations, innovation clusters and industrial partners both in Denmark and internationally.  Harnessing the power of data by enabling sustainable and secure digital solutions in these key areas: Digital and sustainable production, sustainable business innovation, digital water technologies and smart city applications.  Disseminating knowledge through national and international conferences, webinars and workshops, white papers, peer reviewed articles, and articles in relevant scientific journals, industry magazines, and news outlets.   Your main workplace will be in Hørsholm, situated in the DTU Science Park, just 20 km north of Copenhagen. Reporting to Head of IoT Architecture and Technology, Michael Vaa, you will enjoy a flexible work environment that includes the option of remote work on select days.  Your profile  To excel in this role, we are looking for someone with:  An academic background in electronics engineering, at the B.Sc. level or above, specializing in electronic hardware and firmware design with solid knowledge of electronic product cyber security requirements and standards and preferably with knowledge of IoT technology, sensor technology, and wireless communication.  A track record of minimum 8-10 years' experience in developing and implementing digital and electronics solutions and technologies. If you have a M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree 5 years’ experience will suffice.   Enthusiasm for engaging holistically with IoT technology, both through advisory consultancy and applied research projects.  A capacity to manage multiple projects and a drive for continuous personal growth and knowledge enhancement.  A proactive, focused approach to work, with strong project management skills, driving tasks to completion.  Exceptional communication skills, enabling seamless collaboration across organizational, and professional boundaries.  A good sense of humour and the desire to be part of a team working toward a common goal.   Additional information    If you are passionate about driving IoT innovation and leveraging your skills to guide businesses towards a more sustainable future, we invite you to explore the exciting role of IoT Senior Specialist at FORCE Technology. Embrace the opportunity to influence positive change while honing your expertise. Let us connect and discuss how you can become an integral part of our forward-thinking team.  We can offer a unique workplace with a great diversity of professions and tasks. We work to make the world more sustainable and safer, and as an Approved Technological Service Institute we are a central part of technology development in Denmark.  You will be greeted by more than 1000 enthusiasts who work every day to make the greatest possible benefit to business and society. Everyday life is characterized by busyness, high professionalism, curiosity and humor in an informal atmosphere.  Does this sound like something for you?  If you think this job is for you, send us your application today. We process applications on an ongoing basis and invite candidates for interview along the way. Please note that we only accept electronic applications via our recruitment system.  If you have any questions about the position, please contact Michael Vaa on 4022 3288.  We look forward to receiving your application, CV and other relevant attachments.  At FORCE Technology, we are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment, and we are actively looking for qualified people candidates regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, disability or age.    Ansøg nu       Læs mere                Er du klar til at tage udfordringen op?  Hvis det her lyder som noget for dig, så grib chancen og så send os din ansøgning og CV. Vi indkalder til samtaler løbende, så send gerne allerede i dag.   Ansøg nu           Hurtige facts om FORCE Technology      Blev etableret i        Antal kontorer         Antal medarbejdere                         Et læringsmiljø i konstant bevægelse  Du træder ind i en virksomhed, der hele tiden bevæger sig for at være på forkant med den teknologiske udvikling. Det betyder, at du får mulighed for at arbejde med det nyeste udstyr, udforske ny viden og flytte grænserne for, hvad der er
            muligt, ved at teste ting af, der ikke er prøvet før.  Dermed får du chancen for at udvikle dig i og med din rolle, samtidig med at nye muligheder hele tiden åbner sig. Så i FORCE Technology kan du finde mange forskellige karriereveje. Karriereveje der former sig efter lige
            netop dig, din viden og dine ambitioner.                   Følg os på:                 FORCE Technology – vi hjælper andre til at gøre forskel      FORCE Technology er et internationalt GTS-institut og en vigtig del af rygraden i det danske innovations-system. For siden 1940 har vi hjulpet virksomheder med at tage næste skridt i udviklingen og finde nye og bedre
          teknologiske
          løsninger. Det kan vi, fordi vi er specialister på teknologi, og fordi vores over 1.000 dygtige og dedikerede medarbejdere, der er fordelt på over 30 kontorer i 6 lande, står klar til at hjælpe med uvildig rådgivning, analyse, test og
          inspektioner.    Vi er stolte af vores arbejde og af, at vi kan være med til at sikre en mere bæredygtig fremtid, når vi fx hjælper med at forlænge levetiden på et produkt eller finder en ny måde at bruge det på. Ligesom vi er stolte af at bidrage til en
          mere sikker verden, når vi undersøger sikkerheden i en komponent, et materiale, et system eller noget helt fjerde. title: Development Engineer - DTU Wind
description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                     Esc                                 Development Engineer - DTU Wind        Roskilde, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   The section for System Engineering and Optimization (SYS) at DTU Wind and Energy Systems is offering an exciting opportunity to work as an a development engineer. You will work within the field of system engineering applied to wind based energy systems (Wind Farms, Wind Clusters, and Hybrid Power Plants, including wind, solar, batteries, P2X), in collaboration with domain experts from different sections.  The job You will join an international team that works with developing methods and software tools for supporting research internally at DTU and externally in the wind industry. The System Engineering and Optimization section of DTU Wind is a group of researchers and development engineers working closely with domain experts from other sections to address real problems faced by the wind industry to simulate, design and control complex wind-based energy systems.  Furthermore, you will be part of a dynamic work environment with a pleasant team atmosphere, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your academical, technical, industrial, and personal skills. Besides participation in cutting-edge research, as a development engineer, you are given the opportunity to lead the development of world-class scientific software tools used in research projects, collaborate with industry, participate in writing papers, participate in teaching training courses, and co-supervise MSc students, which allows them to develop various skills for the next stages of their career.  Our expectations of you In the position you are expected to contribute to high-quality research and develop high-quality code at the intersection of wind farm flow modelling, wind based energy system design and control and electrical systems engineering.  We imagine that you are a self-motivated and team-oriented person who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys working with complex topics. You must hold a MSc or equivalent and to be successful in the position you have expertise within:   Scientific python programming  Optimization and / or Control  Problem-solving, and ability to create efficient numerical algorithms   On a personal level you possess:   Excellent command of the English language  Good ability to present results in written documents and oral presentations.   Finally, it is highly advantegeuous, if you have experience with:   Machine Learning / AI  Wind Farm Flow Modelling  Wind Farm design and / or control  Wind farm electrical cable layout optimization  Contributing to open-source software development and documentation, CI and community engagement  Running code on high performance computers and / or GPUs  version control systems such as Git.  simulation tools and environments relevant to wind energy (e.g., PyWake, TOPFARM, FLORIS, WRF, FAST, HAWC2, WAsP).   What we offer in return DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation, and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility. The SYS section is developing research-based software used by many wind energy companies, which will offer you a unique position to effectively impact society through your high quality research.  Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations (AC).  Expected starting date is 1st of March 2024 or as soon as possible according to mutual agreement. The position is a full-time position.  Application and contact Please submit your online application no later than 30 December 2023. Open the “Apply now” link, fill out the form and attach your motivated application, CV and exam certificates.  If you would like additional information about the position, please contact Head of Section Pierre-Elouan Réthoré pire@dtu.dk, +45 2133 1293.  Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.  About DTU Wind and Energy Systems At DTU Wind and Energy Systems, we put knowledge to work. The department is one of the largest public research organizations for wind energy systems in the world with about 400 staﬀ members. We educate and train tomorrow’s technology leaders. We collaborate with researchers, global leaders in the energy industries and public authorities around the world to research and develop new technologies and services to power the green transition.  Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                     Senior Full Stack Developer for Generative AI Projects     About the job  At KPMG NewTech, we are passionate about AI and how new technologies can change the way companies and organizations work.  We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our growing Machine Learning and Quantum team. If you are passionate about Generative AI, and the newest trends and developments in the industry, you might be our new colleague.  We manage AI projects from idea to implementation  At KPMG NewTech, our Machine Learning team manages AI projects from start to finish: identifying emerging business issues, crafting innovative models, executing and rolling out scalable systems, and empowering peers and customers to leverage the full potential of AI.  As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you will work on different projects critical to our clients' needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects.  We expect you to display leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic to support other team members in developing expertise.  Our team  The Machine Learning and Quantum team is focused on delivering solutions using the latest developments in the AI space. Our team consists of diverse individuals with backgrounds in data science, software, UX, business, and engineering. We are passionate about using AI to solve real-world problems for our clients and take pride in being experts in the field.  Currently, we are heavily focused on generative AI and how recent and ongoing developments are shaping the landscape.  Our team is dedicated to creating an inclusive and welcoming work environment for all employees. We value diversity and believe it is crucial to our success.  About our newest team member:  Minimum qualifications:   B.E. or M.Sc . in Computer Science or a related field.  5+ years of industry experience.  Excellent communication and teamwork skills.  Demonstrated ability to lead complex software development projects from conception to deployment.   Preferred qualifications:   Solid proficiency in frontend technologies such as Angular/React, Typescript/JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS/SCSS.  Experience with backend languages and frameworks like C#, Python, NodeJS, SQL, and NoSQL.  Familiarity with cloud providers like AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus.  Knowledge of containerization, such as Docker.  Having a pragmatic approach without over-engineering.  Drive for continuous learning and staying updated with the evolving tech landscape.  Knowledge and experience in the generative AI space.   Responsibilities:   Interact directly with clients to understand their requirements, provide technical insights, and ensure that the development aligns with their expectations.  Lead the design and implementation of scalable software architecture.  Foster a team culture that values inclusiveness, collaboration, and making a meaningful impact.  Mentor junior developers and team members, providing guidance and support for their growth and development. Lead by example in both technical expertise and professional conduct.  Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices.   Why join us?  We offer a dynamic and inclusive work environment that supports your professional growth and development. With competitive compensation and benefits, flexible work arrangements, and a commitment to learning and innovation, we provide opportunities for you to excel in your career.  At our organization, we value and respect diversity. We believe that a diverse workforce leads to better outcomes for our clients and employees. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, abilities, identities, and perspectives to apply.  Please don’t hesitate to contact Barbara Isaksen, Manager in Machine Learning and Quantum, at +45 31415095 or baisaksen@kpmg.com , if you’d like to know more about the position.              Application due 17/12/2023  Start date Start as soon as possible   Position type Management Consulting      Work hours  Workplace Copenhagen       Website      Questions regarding the position     Barbara Isaksen  Manager        baisaksen@kpmg.com                                                   Follow us               KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 144 countries and have over 236,000 people working in member firms around the world. We work closely with a broad range of clients, such as business corporations, governments and public sector agencies and not-for-profit organisations. We support them in mitigating risks and exploiting business opportunities.  KPMG in Denmark is the fastest growing professional services firm in Denmark, achieving 1,365,279 million DKK in revenue in FY22. Together, over 1100 employees and partners work to deliver value to our clients through a combination of deep local insight and strong global perspectives. We tailor our approach to the challenge at hand, and we are constantly pushing boundaries to deliver the best services and solutions for our clients.  KPMG P/S, Dampfærgevej 28, 2100 København Ø, Tel: +45 7070 7760, CVR no. 25578198                               ShareThis Copy and Paste

Data Scientist til Skade DKs AI og Data Science team            Er du en stærk Data Scientist med interesse for Operational Analytics, og har du en interesse for at udvikle og drifte prædiktive modeller, udføre eksperimentelle analyser, og optimere eksisterende applikationer? Har du lyst til at blive en del af vores AI og Data Science team, med højt engagement, masser af gode ideer og god stemning, hvor alle arbejder på at gøre en forskel? Så er det dig, vi søger!    Vi er i Tryg i gang med en større udvikling inden for digital transformation. Her spiller AI og Data Science en vigtig rolle, og til dette har vi behov for flere dygtige Data Scientists og Data Engineeres til at understøtte de mange spændende initiativer.      Om os | Bred kontaktflade og fuld fokus på samarbejde  AI og Data Science teamet sidder som en del af Data & BI afdelingen, som servicerer og understøtter vores Skadebehandlingsafdeling i DK med de rigtige data-løsninger til effektiv driftsstyring, øget digitalisering, kundeoplevelser, kvalitetssikring og procesoptimering. Afdelingen består af talentfulde kollegaer som arbejder inden for Data Engineering, Data Science og Business Intelligence. Du kommer derfor til at indgå i et stærkt fagligt miljø, hvor der konstant er fokus på at sikre en kontinuerlig udvikling. Fordi vi er en afdeling bestående af flere teams med mange forskellige kompetencer, har vi et stort fokus på sparring med hinanden, kompetenceudvikling samt et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø – der gør arbejdsdagen sjovere og nemmere.    Vi lægger stor vægt på et samarbejde på tværs af afdelinger og funktioner, og du vil som Data Scientist i AI & Data Science teamet have et tæt samarbejde med kollegaer og vores Data Scientist community. Gennem samarbejde med forskellige kollegaer og samarbejdspartnere bliver du rustet med et solidt netværk, som sætter dig i stand til at løse dine opgaver bedre og hurtigere, og som samtidig sikrer en kontinuerlig udvikling af dine kompetencer. Det er en forudsætning, at du har en naturlig tilgang til samarbejde med forskellige kollegaer, og ser det som en del af dit arbejde at søge viden og sparre med andre kollegaer.      Om jobbet | Operational Analytics & Data Science  Som Data Scientist kommer du til at have mange forskellige opgaver inden for Operational Analytics & Data Science. Det betyder, at du bl.a. vil arbejde med udvikling og drift af prædiktive modeller, A/B testing, webservices og cloud computing. Fokus er at skabe værdi, og derfor kan løsningen i nogle tilfælde være simple regler og i andre tilfælde mere avancerede statistiske modeller.    Tryg har en ambitiøs datastrategi og arbejder målrettet for at etablere en Cloud baseret data- og analyseplatform, så det bliver hurtigere og nemmere at sikre tilgængeligheden af data, forbedre processer og sikre de rigtige værktøjer.    Dine arbejdsopgaver som Data Scientist vil typisk være:   Udvikle og træne prædiktive modeller  Drifte modeller og applikationer i skyen  Integrere datakilder i nye og eksisterende applikationer  Effektmåling via monitorering og A/B testing  Udvikle services til interaktion og overvågning af applikationer     De vigtigste værktøjer, som vi benytter, er bl.a. Microsoft Azure med Python, Kubernetes, Docker, GitLab, Kafka og SQL, men vi er meget åbne for at tage nye teknologier i brug. Derudover, har vi ambitioner om i højere grad at gøre brug af GenAI og LLM, hvilket vi håber du har lyst til at bidrage til.      Om dig | Skarp Data Scientist med fokus på værdiskabende Data Science løsninger  Vi forventer, at du har en relevant uddannelse inden for Computer Science, Datalogi, Statistik, Matematik eller tilsvarende. Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har hands-on erfaring med end-to-en Machine Learning processen, der bl.a. omfatter:   Databehandling  Model udvikling  Implementering og monitorering af modeller i produktion     Der er en forventning om, at du har kendskab til de mest almindelige Data Science værktøjer og sprog, og som et minimum er flydende i Python. Udover Python, så benytter vi Kubernetes Microsoft Azure, Docker, GitLab, Kafka, SQL mv. og et kendskab til disse vil være en fordel.    Vigtigst af alt er dog, at du brænder at gøre en forskel gennem udvikling af prædiktive modeller og eksperimentelle analyser sammen med os!      Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!  Hvis du kan genkende dig selv i beskrivelsen, send gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler og lukker processen, når vi har fundet den rette. Ansøgningsfrist er d. 15. december.    Har du spørgsmål eller ønsker at vide mere, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Data & BI, Anette Schrøder Mikkelsen via mail: anette.m@tryg.dk .                    job rekvisition ID:  25668        Vi er en del af Solsikkeprogrammet og opfordrer alle uanset kønsidentitet, alder, baggrund, handikap eller oprindelse til at søge stillingen. Vi er stolte af at have høj medarbejdertilfredshed, stærk faglighed og lige muligheder for at udvikle sin karriere i Tryg-koncernen. Tryg er Skandinaviens største skadesforsikringsselskab med aktiviteter i Danmark, Norge og Sverige. I Danmark består koncernen blandt andet af Tryg, Alka, TJM og Tryg Garanti. TryghedsGruppen er hovedejer af Tryg-koncernen og står bag TrygFonden. Sammen arbejder vi hver dag, på hver vores måde, for at gøre danskernes hverdag mere tryg. Se mere på www.tryg.dk             Ansøg nu »    Ansøg nu    Ansøg nu        Start ansøgning med LinkedIn                  Start           Vent venligst... title: OPS Data Scientist
description: ×                  OPS Data Scientist         Applications are considered on a rolling basis         Multiple locations     Hybrid                I'm interested              Applications are considered on a rolling basis         Multiple locations     Hybrid        Job Description  Join our Operational Analytics team as a Data Scientist, where you'll play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data to uncover strategic insights and drive tangible business growth. As a key member of the Ops Data & Analytics team, consisting of three analysts and one data scientist, you'll be at the forefront of transforming raw data into intuitive insights.  This role primarily focuses on text analysis, speech-to-text analysis, and other predictive analysis, ensuring alignment with those who have a keen interest in these specific areas.  Utilize advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze extensive datasets, extracting actionable insights. Engage with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges, fostering collaborative efforts to develop data-driven solutions that optimize customer processes and enhance operational efficiency.  Main tasks and responsibilities:   Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques, with a primary focus on text analysis, speech-to-text analysis, and other predictive analysis.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges, developing data-driven solutions to optimize customer processes and drive operational efficiency.  Design and implement predictive models and algorithms for forecasting, anomaly detection, and decision-making.  Develop and maintain data pipelines, ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the data lifecycle.  Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to facilitate informed decision-making.  Stay updated on the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in data science and analytics.   Skills & Requirements   A bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.  Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, with experience in data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.  Solid understanding of statistical concepts and experience applying statistical modeling techniques.  Experience with machine learning algorithms, data mining, and predictive modeling.  Familiarity with databases and SQL for data extraction and manipulation.  Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently or as part of a team.  Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.   Experience:    Experience as a data scientist, data engineer, data specialist or data analyst.  A strong track record of building and deploying predictive and/or prescriptive models.  Proven programming and modelling expertise.  Experience with cloud platforms, such as AWS or Azure, is a plus.  Prior experience in customer analytics or process optimization is advantageous but not mandatory.   What we offer   An opportunity to work in a large, high-performing international company, in a dynamic environment that is constantly changing.  A corporate culture that is professional and dynamic, yet informal. Bureaucracy is kept to a minimum, as we expect our skilled employees to make long lasting and impactful decisions to shape our future.  Highly competent, dedicated, and friendly co-workers with strong collaboration across the Nordics.  Hybrid work environment (2-3 days remote work per week).  Emphasis on work-life balance.  Anticipated travel activity of 2-3 times per year, each trip lasting a few days.  Opportunity to work with the latest technologies in machine learning and AI.   This position can be in any of our Nordic locations in Helsinki, Hvidovre, Solna, Stavanger or Lysaker.  Are you interested?  If you are intrigued by this position and possess the right profile and mindset, please submit your application and CV via the link. Applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews will be planned as soon as a suitable candidate is identified.  If you have any questions about the position, you can contact Philip Aarup, Team Leader of OPS Data & Analytics.          Great Place to Work    We invest in you   Innovative and looking to the future   BeHealthy | Your health is important to us   Social events for all employees   Engaged colleagues   Dynamic work environment   Employee benefits and discounts   Competitive insurance and pension plans   We give back to society   Gode pensions- og forsikringsforhold   Vi investerer i din udvikling   Vi giver tilbage til samfundet   Medarbejderfordele og rabatter   Dedikeret kollegaer   Globale muligheder   Sociale arrangementer for alle medarbejdere   Innovativ og fremadtænkende virksomhed   Gode forsikrings- og pensjonsordninger   Engasjerte kolleger   Sosiale arrangement for alle ansatte   BeHealthy | Din helse er viktig for oss   Innovativt og fremtidsrettet selskap   Vi investerer i deg   Vi gir tilbake til samfunnet   Personalgoder og rabatter   Dynamisk arbeidsmiljø   Sociala evenemang för alla anställda   Dynamisk arbetsmiljö   Vi ger tillbaka till samhället   Konkurrenskraftiga pensioner & försäkringar   Innovation, förbättring och utveckling   Globala möjligheter   Friskvård - din hälsa är viktig för oss   Engagerade kollegor   Personalförmåner via Benify             About the company  We are a Nordic bank with more than 1,200 colleagues in Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland, and proud to be part of Banco Santander, one of the largest banks in the world with a solid history going back more than 160 years.  Our purpose is to help people and businesses prosper and we aim to be the best retail and commercial bank, earning the lasting loyalty of our people, customers, shareholders and communities - through simple, personal and fair banking.  In our organization we foster and value an engaged, challenging and passionate environment that provides opportunities for personal and professional growth. We operate in an ever changing environment, and believe the key to success is innovative involvement, a playful approach to active learning and continuous improvement in our daily work.  We are firmly committed to being a responsible bank in the way we operate, our culture, caring for our environment and giving back to society. Banco Santander is recognized as the most sustainable bank in the world following the publication of the Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) for 2019.  Read more about responsible banking on our global webpages.  Santander Consumer Bank is one of the largest Nordic banks providing loans and credits, credit cards, deposits and insurance to private customers.  To learn more about Santander in the Nordics, please visit our local webpages  https://www.santanderconsumer.no /  https ://www.santanderconsumer.se/om-oss /  https://santanderconsumer.dk/om-os/  https://www.santanderconsumer.fi/            T A Nordic Bank with global strength       T Part of Banco Santander – one of the world’s largest financial institutions       T Banco Santander’s history goes back more than 160 years       T World’s Most Sustainable Bank 2019 (Dow Jones Sustainability Index 2019)       T Over 1200 employees across the Nordics       T We serve over 1.6 million customers       T Strategic partnerships with over 10 000 car dealers, merchants and brokers       T Innovation is key to our future success       T Banco Santanders historie går mere end 160 år tilbage       T Verdens mest bæredygtige bank 2019 (Dow Jones Sustainability Index 2019)       T 1.200 ansatte på tværs af Norden       T Over 1.6 mio kunder       T Strategiske partnerskaber med mere end 10.000 bilforhandlere, indkøbere og brokere       T Innovation er nøglen til vores fremtidige succes       T Vi leverer digitale kundeoplevelser       T En Nordisk bank med global styrke       T En del af Banco Santander – en af verdens største finansielle institutioner       T Historien vår går tilbake til 1963 i Norge       T Over 600 000 kunder og 3500 partnere i Norge       T 50/50 fordeling menn og kvinner       T Over 600 000 kunder og 3500 partnere i Norge       T Størst på billån i Norge       T Fremtidsrettede | Først ute i Norge med ApplePay       T Vi er dedikert til å være en ansvarlig långiver! title: Business Analyst med interesse for Analytics og Cloud til udvikling af fremtidens Azure dataplatform
description:
Denne hjemmeside bruger cookies Denne side viser alle cookies som kan fremkomme på candidate.hr-manager.net domænet og listen herunder er derfor ikke cookies som fremgår hos alle. Hvis du tillader cookies, accepterer du at Talentech og tredjeparter, gemmer de cookies, som du har valgt. Hvis du ikke giver samtykke, vil vi kun gemme de cookies, som er nødvendige for at du kan bruge siden. Du kan altid ændre dit samtykke ved at klikke på knappen nederst i venstre hjørne.  Sælg eller del ikke mine personlige oplysninger Kun nødvendige cookies Tillad alle cookies Vis detaljer OK Kun nødvendige cookies Tillad valgte Tillad alle cookies  Nødvendig  Præferencer  Statistik  Marketing Vis detaljer Cookiedeklaration [#IABV2SETTINGS#] Om  Nødvendig (7)   Præferencer (0)   Statistik (5)   Marketing (1)   Uklassificeret (2) Nødvendige cookies hjælper med at gøre en hjemmeside brugbar ved at aktivere grundlæggende funktioner såsom side-navigation og adgang til sikre områder af hjemmesiden. Hjemmesiden kan ikke fungere ordentligt uden disse cookies. Session HTTP ARRAffinitySameSite styleguide.hrmts.net Anvendes til at fordele trafikken på hjemmesiden over flere servere for at optimere svartider. Session HTTP Præference cookies gør det muligt for en hjemmeside at huske oplysninger, der ændrer den måde hjemmesiden ser ud eller opfører sig på. F.eks. dit foretrukne sprog, eller den region, du befinder dig i. Vi bruger ikke cookies af denne type. Statistiske cookies giver hjemmesideejere indsigt i brugernes interaktion med hjemmesiden, ved at indsamle og rapportere oplysninger anonymt.Bemærk at disse cookies er generelle for domænet candidate.hr-manager.net og derfor ikke fremgår hos alle. Loven fastslår, at vi kan gemme cookies på din enhed, hvis de er strengt nødvendige for at sikre leveringen af den tjeneste, du udtrykkeligt har anmodet om at bruge. For alle andre typer cookies skal vi indhente dit samtykke. Dette websted bruger forskellige typer af cookies. Nogle cookies sættes af tredjeparts tjenester, der vises på vores sider. Du kan til enhver tid ændre eller tilbagetrække dit samtykke fra Cookiedeklarationen på vores hjemmeside. Få mere at vide om, hvem vi er, hvordan du kan kontakte os, og hvordan vi behandler persondata i vores Privatlivspolitik. Angiv venligst dit samtykke-ID og -dato, når du kontakter os angående dit samtykke. Dit samtykke gælder for følgende domæner: candidate.hr-manager.net/ Cookiedeklarationen er sidst opdateret d. 11/9/23 af Cookiebot           Your current state: Deny. Your current state: Do not sell or share my personal information. Your current state: Allow selection (Necessary , Preferences , Statistics , Marketing ). Your current state: Allow all. Your consent ID: 0 Consent date: Change your consent | Withdraw your consent Do not sell or share my personal information    Advarsel Din browser er forældet. Få den bedste brugeroplevelse med hurtigere hastighed, sikkerhed og privatliv ved at bruge den nyeste version af Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari eller Opera.   ×                                         Business Analyst med interesse for Analytics og Cloud til udvikling af fremtidens Azure dataplatform            Vil du være med til at udvikle fremtidens Azure baserede analytiske dataplatform, som skal understøtte Skatteforvaltningens strategiske udvikling af analytics-området? Så har vi brug for dig!   Hvad vil vi med den analytiske dataplatform? Vores vision er at tilbyde hele Skatteforvaltningen en skalerbar, sikker og fleksibel dataplatform, der kan understøtte brugere af platformen i behovet for selvstændigt at kunne udvikle Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence og Machine learning løsninger. Vi har i udviklingen af platformen fokus på brugeroplevelsen og værdien af platformen fra et brugerperspektiv. Vi arbejder derfor tæt sammen med vores brugere. Vi har prioriteret automatiseringer, som giver brugere en hurtigere adgang til data. Vi implementerer værktøjer, som skal hjælpe brugere med at forbedre datakvaliteten og højne kvaliteten af de produkter, som brugerne udvikler.  Om stillingen Vi søger en nysgerrig, selvstændig og udadvendt kollega, som har stærke egenskaber inden for formidling.  Arbejdet med at udvikle, drifte og vedligeholde vores dataplatform foregår i flere udviklingsteams. Udviklingsteamsene har en stor faglig diversitet, som blandt andet tæller DevOps Engineers, arkitekter, Data Engineers og Product Owners. Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med ledelsen af platformen, i særlig grad platformens Product Manager. Platformen arbejder agilt inden for rammeværket SAFe, og du vil derfor indgå i de arbejdsmetoder, som anvendes i SAFe.  Dine opgaver vil bl.a. omfatte.    At beskrive og omsætte forretningskrav fra brugere af platformen til udviklingsopgaver  At beskrive og optegne brugervendte processer (Business Process Model and Notation)  At udarbejde brugervejledninger  Bistå med onboarding og undervisning af nye brugere af platformen  Bistå Product Manager og System arkitekt med afklaring af forretningsmæssige og tekniske problemstillinger  Bistå Product Owners med forretningsmæssige afklaringer   For at lykkes i stillingen, kræver det, at du finder det spændende at arbejde sammen med mennesker med forskellige faglige baggrunde. Derudover skal du have lyst til at lære og at arbejde med fagområder, som du måske ikke tidligere har beskæftiget dig med.  Stærkt fagfællesskab og kollegialt sammenhold   Som Business Analyst bliver du en del af et stort fagligt fællesskab i Center for Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence, der består af mere end 80 medarbejdere, både Platform Engineers, Data Engineers, BI-udviklere, Business Analysts, Product Owners, driftsansvarlige og generalister.  Vi prioriterer tid til sparring og til at dyrke vores faglighed. Vi afholder tre årlige centerdage og et seminar med både interne og eksterne oplæg, workshops og andre indslag, der skal styrke vores sociale sammenhold og faglighed. Derudover har vi flere Communities of Practices (fagfællesskaber), hvori de forskellige fagligheder kan dele viden, erfaringsudveksle og løse opgaver, der sikrer udvikling og forbedring af vores område.   Om dig Din akademiske baggrund er mindre vigtig, denne kan fx være Cand.It, Cand.Comm eller Cand.Scient.Pol. Du kan både være i starten af din karriere eller have et par års erfaring. Du er analytisk og logisk tænkende, og har gode skriftlige og mundtlige kompetencer. Derudover har du stærke kompetencer i Office365.  Som person er du først og fremmest en holdspiller, der kan begå dig i en udviklingsorienteret organisation. Du er udadvendt og god til at omgås alle typer af interessenter, herunder andre styrelser i Skatteforvaltningen. Du er god til at inddrage andres kompetencer, når du løser problemer, og samtidig kan du bevare helikopterperspektivet, når du møder komplekse problemstillinger.  Det vil være en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du har erfaring med en eller flere af nedenstående punkter:   Procesanalyse og procesmodellering i fx QualiWare eller Visio  Facilitering og afholdelse af workshops  Datawarehousing og ETL-processer  Cloud-teknologi  IT-udviklingsprojekter  Opgavestyringsværktøjet JIRA og vidensdelingsværktøjet Confluence.   Et særligt arbejdsmiljø i Udviklings og Forenklingsstyrelsen Du bliver en del af et dynamisk og kreativt arbejdsmiljø med mere end 1.500 specialister, der har forskellige uddannelses- og erhvervsmæssige baggrunde. Udviklings- og Forenklingsstyrelsen er en lærende organisation med et godt sammenhold, fagligt fællesskab og en god feedback-kultur. Vi tager ansvar og har ambitioner om at forbedre os, men vi har samtidig plads til humor og en uformel tone.  Kontakt og ansættelsesvilkår   Send din ansøgning med CV, dokumentation for uddannelse samt eventuelt yderligere materiale via linket ”Søg stillingen” senest den 5. januar 2023. Vi kalder løbende ind til samtaler. Stillingen er med opstart snarest muligt.  Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte Souschef Tobias Dabelsteen på tlf. 72 38 27 41.   Vi vil i rekrutteringsprocessen bede dig løse en case, gennemføre en personlighedsanalyse og en logisk test. Der vil forud for ansættelsen blive indhentet straffeattest.   Du bliver ansat på overenskomstvilkår i henhold til gældende overenskomst for akademikere i staten (AC), overenskomst for kontorfunktionærer, laboranter og It-medarbejdere (HK) eller overenskomst for Fuldmægtige m.fl. (DTS) i Skatteministeriet.   Ansættelsesområdet er Skatteministeriet med tilhørende institutioner. Arbejdsstedet er Osvald Helmuths Vej 4, 2000 Frederiksberg.      Om Udviklings- og Forenklingsstyrelsen  ’Vi sikrer velfungerende it-løsninger, så den samlede Skatteforvaltning kan løse sin opgave’  Udviklings- og Forenklingsstyrelsen er en tværfaglig styrelse og har til opgave at udvikle, drifte og vedligeholde nye og eksisterende it-systemer i Skatteforvaltningen, så de er stabile, sikre og omkostningseffektive.  Vores medarbejdere er fagligt kompetente og specialiserede og samtidig i stand til at arbejde tæt sammen med andre fagligheder på tværs af Skatteministeriet. Kun gennem et stærkt fagligt fællesskab på tværs af fagområderne kan vi lykkes med den omfangsrige og komplekse opgave, vi har.  Vi søger løbende nye kolleger, som deler vores ambition om at sikre fundamentet for finansieringen af den offentlige sektor.   Læs mere om Udviklings- og Forenklingsstyrelsen på  www.ufst.dk . title: Azure udviklere til udvikling af fremtidens cloud analytics platform
description:

Hvis du tillader cookies, accepterer du at Talentech og tredjeparter, gemmer de cookies, som du har valgt. Hvis du ikke giver samtykke, vil vi kun gemme de cookies, som er nødvendige for at du kan bruge siden. Du kan altid ændre dit samtykke ved at klikke på knappen nederst i venstre hjørne. Hjemmesiden kan ikke fungere ordentligt uden disse cookies.
