Loven fastslår, at vi kan gemme cookies på din enhed, hvis de er strengt nødvendige for at sikre leveringen af den tjeneste, du udtrykkeligt har anmodet om at bruge. For alle andre typer cookies skal vi indhente dit samtykke. Dette websted bruger forskellige typer af cookies. Nogle cookies sættes af tredjeparts tjenester, der vises på vores sider. Du kan til enhver tid ændre eller tilbagetrække dit samtykke fra Cookiedeklarationen på vores hjemmeside. Få mere at vide om, hvem vi er, hvordan du kan kontakte os, og hvordan vi behandler persondata i vores Privatlivspolitik. Angiv venligst dit samtykke-ID og -dato, når du kontakter os angående dit samtykke. Dit samtykke gælder for følgende domæner: candidate.hr-manager.net/ Cookiedeklarationen er sidst opdateret d. 11/9/23 af Cookiebot           Your current state: Deny. Your current state: Do not sell or share my personal information. Your current state: Allow selection (Necessary , Preferences , Statistics , Marketing ). Your current state: Allow all. Your consent ID: 0 Consent date: Change your consent | Withdraw your consent Do not sell or share my personal information    Advarsel Din browser er forældet. Få den bedste brugeroplevelse med hurtigere hastighed, sikkerhed og privatliv ved at bruge den nyeste version af Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari eller Opera.   ×                                         Azure udviklere til udvikling af fremtidens cloud analytics platform            Vil du være med til at videreudvikle vores nye Azure-baserede analytiske dataplatform, som skal understøtte Skatteforvaltningen i at bekæmpe svig og sikre korrekt opkrævning af told og afgifter? Platformen, som skal understøtte Skatteforvaltningens strategiske udvikling af analytics-området. Vi har brug for dig!    Hvad vil vi med den analytiske dataplatform?  Vores vision er at tilbyde hele Skatteforvaltningen en skalerbar, sikker og fleksibel dataplatform, der kan understøtte brugere af platformen i selvstændigt at kunne udvikle Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence og Machine Learning løsninger.  Det er et grundlæggende princip, at platformen følger industristandarder/Best practices og DevOps principper, hvor compliance er indtænkt pr. design. Samtidig er det vigtigt, at vores brugere hurtigt kan komme fra idé til produkt i et self-service setup.  Derfor skal vores infrastruktur understøtte enkle brugerrejser, hvor komponenterne er sammenhængende, processer er automatiserede og platformen indeholder de værktøjer, der efterspørges.  Vi lancerede første udgave af platformen i juli 2023, hvorefter brugerne kunne påbegynde arbejdet med at gøre Skatteforvaltningens data tilgængelige til ledere og medarbejdere på en lovlig og sikker måde.  Vi har stadig mange ønsker til videreudvikling af platformen, og du vil derfor få rig mulighed for at udvikle en af de mest moderne Azure cloudbaserede dataplatforme i Danmark.   Hvilke komponenter anvender vi i dag på platformen?   Analytisk Dataplatform er bygget på Azure og Azure-kompatible teknologier. Platformen skal sikre, at der ved self-service kan gennemføres ingest og storage, ETL, Data Discovery, Business Intelligence og Machine Learning.    Platformen benytter sig eksempelvis af nedenstående værktøjer:  Azure DevOps, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Key Vault, Azure AD, Azure Synapse Analytics herunder Spark samt serverless SQL pools, Azure SQL, Azure Machine Learning, Azure API Management, Databricks, Power BI, GIT og Terraform.   Hvilket team bliver du en del af, og hvilken arbejdsdag kan du forvente?  I Analytisk Dataplatform arbejder vi i selvstyrende agile teams, der har ansvaret for udvikling, vedligeholdelse og drift af platformen. Her er der stor faglig diversitet, som blandt andet tæller Platform Engineers, DevOps Engineers, Arkitekter, Data Engineers, Product Owners og Scrum Masters.  Du bliver en del af et team, der arbejder agilt inden for rammeværket SAFe, og du vil derfor indgå i de arbejdsmetoder, som anvendes i SAFe.    Hvem er du?  Vi søger flere Azure udviklere til platformen. Derfor søger vi både dig med erfaring med Azure cloud og DevOps, men du kan også være helt nyuddannet, eller med kortere erfaring på arbejdsmarkedet. Vigtigt er dog, at du har interesse i udvikling af en cloud-baseret dataplatform, at du trives med at arbejde i et team og trives med en agil kultur.  Vi forestiller os, at du har en relevant uddannelsesmæssig baggrund, fx cand.it, datalog, softwareingeniør, datamatiker, en anden it-faglig uddannelse eller tilsvarende IT-erfaring.  Vi har et stærkt fokus på uddannelse og vil derfor investere i din udvikling, så du får kvalifikationer og erfaring inden for nedenstående områder. Hvis du allerede har noget af pakken, er det kun et plus.   Automatisering af infrastruktur gennem kode, fx ved brug af Terraform og powershell  Programmering i et højt niveau-sprog, gerne Python  Et indgående kendskab til Azure, evt. erfaring fra andre cloudplatforme.  Opsætning af CICD-pipelines til flere miljøer med værktøjer såsom Jenkins eller Azure DevOps  Håndtering af store datamængder, lagring og transport  Produktionslægning og overvågning af machine learning modeller  Principperne og anvendelse af DevOps, GitOps, MLOPs  Anvende software design principper til udvikling af løsninger, herunder at skrive automatiserede tests til løsningen.   Det kan også være du besidder nogen af nedenstående certificeringer:   DP-201: Designing an Azure Data Solution  DP-200: Implementing an Azure Data Solution  DP-203: Azure Data Engineer Associate  AZ-400: DevOps Engineer expert  AI-900: Azure AI Fundamentals  DP-900: Azure Data Fundamentals  PL-300: Data Analyst Associate   Koncernsproget er dansk, så vi forventer, at du kan forstå og formulere dig på dansk – både skriftligt og mundtligt.   Stærkt fagfællesskab og kollegialt sammenhold   Som Azure udvikler bliver du en del af et stort fagligt fællesskab i Center for Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence, der består af mere end 80 medarbejdere, både Platform Engineers, Data Engineers, BI-udviklere, Business Analysts, Product Owners, driftsansvarlige og generalister.   Vi prioriterer tid til sparring og til at dyrke vores faglighed. Vi afholder tre årlige centerdage og et seminar med både interne og eksterne oplæg, workshops og andre indslag, der skal styrke vores sociale sammenhold og faglighed. Derudover har vi flere Communities of Practices (fagfællesskaber), hvori de forskellige fagligheder kan vidensdele, erfaringsudveksle og løse opgaver, der sikrer udvikling og forbedring af vores område.    Et særligt arbejdsmiljø i Udviklings og Forenklingsstyrelsen   Du bliver en del af et dynamisk og kreativt arbejdsmiljø med mere end 1.500 specialister, der har forskellige uddannelses- og erhvervsmæssige baggrunde. Udviklings- og Forenklingsstyrelsen er en lærende organisation med et godt sammenhold, fagligt fællesskab og en god feedback-kultur. Vi tager ansvar og har ambitioner om at forbedre os, men vi har samtidig plads til humor og en uformel tone.    Kontakt og ansættelsesvilkår   Send din ansøgning med CV, dokumentation for uddannelse samt eventuelt yderligere materiale via linket ”Søg stillingen” senest den 5. januar 2024   Vi tager kandidater løbende ind til samtale. Stillingen er med opstart snarest muligt.   Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte Souschef Tobias Dabelsteen på tlf. 72 38 27 41.   Vi vil i rekrutteringsprocessen bede om at du præsenterer en praktisk case, gennemfører en personlighedsanalyse og en logisk test. Der vil forud for ansættelsen blive indhentet straffeattest.   Du bliver ansat på overenskomstvilkår i henhold til gældende overenskomst for akademikere i staten (AC), overenskomst for kontorfunktionærer, laboranter og It-medarbejdere (HK) eller overenskomst for Fuldmægtige m.fl. (DTS) i Skatteministeriet.   Ansættelsesområdet er Skatteministeriet med tilhørende institutioner. Arbejdsstedet er Osvald Helmuths Vej 4, 2000      Om Udviklings- og Forenklingsstyrelsen  ’Vi sikrer velfungerende it-løsninger, så den samlede Skatteforvaltning kan løse sin opgave’  Udviklings- og Forenklingsstyrelsen er en tværfaglig styrelse og har til opgave at udvikle, drifte og vedligeholde nye og eksisterende it-systemer i Skatteforvaltningen, så de er stabile, sikre og omkostningseffektive.  Vores medarbejdere er fagligt kompetente og specialiserede og samtidig i stand til at arbejde tæt sammen med andre fagligheder på tværs af Skatteministeriet. Kun gennem et stærkt fagligt fællesskab på tværs af fagområderne kan vi lykkes med den omfangsrige og komplekse opgave, vi har.  Vi søger løbende nye kolleger, som deler vores ambition om at sikre fundamentet for finansieringen af den offentlige sektor.   Læs mere om Udviklings- og Forenklingsstyrelsen på  www.ufst.dk . tilhørsforhold til at søge stillingen. Privacy policy:  Facebook - Privacy policy (opens in a new tab)    Expiry:  Session    Name:     Vendor:  www.facebook.com          Decline all  Save settings  Accept all cookies         Strictly necessary        Functional        Statistical        Marketing      powered by: Cookie Information         Cookie policy   Your consent applies to the following domains:  bestseller.com  The cookie policy was last updated on 01.11.2023      What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small data file stored in your computer, tablet or smartphone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful malware or virus.  How our website uses cookies  Some cookies perform essential functions for our website. Cookies also help us get an overview of your visit to our website so we can continuously optimize and tailor the experience to your needs and interests. For example, cookies remember things like the items added to the shopping cart; whether you have visited our website before; if you are logged in; and the specific language and currency you prefer to see on the website. We also use cookies to target our ads specifically to you on other websites. In general, we use cookies as part of our service to present you with content that is as relevant to you as possible.  You can see the specific services that store cookies and why they do it, under the different categories:   Functional  Statistical  Marketing   How long are cookies stored?  The length of time a cookie is stored on your devices and browsers varies. The lifetime is calculated according to your last visit to the website. When a cookie expires, it is automatically deleted. All our cookies’ lifetimes are specified in our cookie policy.  How to block or delete cookies  You may at any time block all or just third-party cookies completely by changing the browser settings on your computer, tablet or smartphone. The location of these settings will depend on the browser you use. However, you should be aware that if you block all or just third-party cookies, there may be functions and services that you will be unable to use on the website (because these depend on cookies).  You can opt-out of cookies from Google Analytics here .  How can you delete cookies?  It is easy to delete cookies that you have previously accepted. It depends on which browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, etc.) and device (smartphone, tablet, PC, Mac) you are using. You can typically find this information under settings – Security and Privacy – but this may vary from one browser to another.  Specify which device/browser you are using (click the appropriate link):   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Chrome, Android   Changing your consent  You can change your consent by either deleting cookies from your browser or by changing your original choice by clicking the link below:  You can change your consent by clicking here  Remember: If you use more than one browser, you must delete cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  If you have any comments or questions relating to our information and/or processing of personal data, please feel welcome to contact us. 
The cookie policy itself is updated once a month by Cookie Information . If you have any questions about our cookie policy, you are welcome to contact Cookie Information on their website.     Settings  Accept all cookies     powered by: Cookie Information       Functional  Statistical  Marketing                                                Careers  Careers  Sustainability  Sustainability  Our Company  Our Company  News  News  Brands  Brands                 Senior AI Application Engineer                    Join our pioneering team at BESTSELLER, where innovation meets expertise in the realm of AI and machine learning. We are on the lookout for a seasoned Senior AI Application Engineer with a profound passion for data-driven innovation and exceptional skills in developing cutting-edge machine learning solutions.     YOUR NEW ROLE As a pivotal member of BESTSELLER's Data & Analytics department, you will spearhead the development of interactive AI solutions, applications, and dashboards that are the cornerstone of our data-driven decision-making process. Collaborating closely with a team of expert data scientists, engineers, analysts, and various stakeholders from the business. Your role is not just about building solutions but revolutionizing how we understand and utilize data. YOUR TEAM You will be an integral part of a dynamic team within the Data & Analytics department, a group of over 50 data enthusiasts driving the data agenda at BESTSELLER. Our focus is not only on delivering unmatched value to our end consumers but also on maintaining the highest standards of customer satisfaction and quality. You will join a product team of eight highly skilled professionals, all committed to harnessing the potential of data to enhance customer experiences, streamline operations, and drive revenue growth. YOUR IMPACT In your role as a Senior AI Application Engineer, you will: Drive the development of data-driven services and visualizations using tools like Python, Plotly Dash, TensorFlow, Kubernetes, Databricks, Snowflake, and dbt. Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and backend developers to ensure seamless data flow and successful feature implementation. Drive application development, data modeling, and UI/UX development, all aimed at delivering value to our end consumers and ensuring that satisfaction and quality are always on the radar. YOUR BENEFITS A dynamic and challenging role in a fast-paced, decision-driven environment. Collaboration with a diverse, highly skilled team and various business stakeholders. Extensive opportunities for skill enhancement and professional growth in an international setting. Dedicated time for training, education, and a pathway to a wide array of certifications. YOUR PROFILE We are seeking an energetic, proactive team player with: A Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Advanced proficiency in Python and a genuine interest in data engineering and visualization. Proven experience in containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes) and developing/maintaining production-grade web applications. Demonstrated expertise in deploying machine learning-driven applications in production environments. Excellent communication skills for effective technical presentations to non-technical stakeholders. The following qualifications would also be an advantage: Proficiency in Plotly Dash, cloud computing services (GCP, AWS, Azure), and database management (SQL, NoSQL). Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. WORK LOCATION Your primary workplace will be at our vibrant office in Aarhus. WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Emil Hartvig Pedersen (+45 29628203). Otherwise, please send us your application and CV as soon as possible, but no later than December 13th, 2023. We invite for interviews on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the add when we have found the right candidate     ABOUT BESTSELLER At BESTSELLER, we are more than 18,000 people in 38 different countries working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S. We are a family-owned company with a strong foundation and values to build on, empowering us to pursue the ideas we believe in to take BESTSELLER forward. We are committed to diversity and provide equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We strive to create an empowering environment where people can thrive and develop. For more information, visit www.bestseller.com.        You will become part of the BESTSELLER family, a culture where new ideas are welcomed, and all voices are heard. We believe in entrepreneurship; this means you have the freedom to do this in the way which works for you. You get responsibility and the opportunity to develop yourself and your area from day one. We believe in flexibility and autonomy in your daily routine and working location.         At BESTSELLER, we own it. Every chance. Every challenge. Every choice. We’re the global fashion company that’s fast paced and family run. We’re the business that’s built some of the strongest brands in the industry. By empowering every individual to own their journey, we’ve found the courage to keep getting better. To act more sustainably. To foster diversity and provide equal opportunities. To compete more confidently. And to keep challenging the status quo. Time and time again. We are BESTSELLER - and together, we own it. title: PhD scholarship in Prescriptive Analytics for District Heating Networks at DTU Engineering Technology
description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                     Esc                                 PhD scholarship in Prescriptive Analytics for District Heating Networks at DTU Engineering Technology        Ballerup, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   Do you want to break new ground in technology development and implementation in the District Heating industry?  The fault management and maintenance/renovation practices in district heating networks are currently limited to reactive or preventive approaches. These inefficient practices pose significant challenges to the performance of modern district heating systems. Furthermore, the aging infrastructure of many district heating systems necessitates constant renovation. However, the existing approach to renovation planning is suboptimal and lacks a proactive strategy. Addressing these challenges is crucial for improving the performance and reliability of district heating systems. We have an opening at DTU Engineering Technology for a PhD-student on developing Prescriptive Analytics tool for District Heating Networks addressing these challenges.  You will become a member of the AI, Mathematics, and Software research group at DTU Engineering Technology under the supervision of Associate professor Maryamsadat Tahavori from DTU Engineering Technology.  Responsibilities and qualifications Your primary tasks will be to   Conduct research in the intersection between academia and the industry  Write academic papers aimed at high-impact journals  Participate in international conferences and workshop  Disseminate research results and teach as part of the overall PhD education  Learn the role of the researcher and the specific tasks how to conduct research  Participate in teaching and student project supervision   The responsibilities may vary based on your profile and interest as well as project requirements.  You must have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree in fields such as Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related discipline.  We imagine that you are an ambitious, self-organized individual with curiosity and deep interests in how new technologies can be usefully applied in industry.  To succeed in the job, proficiency in programming languages commonly used in AI/ML, particularly Python, and familiarity with data analysis libraries, frameworks, and data visualization tools is essential. Furthermore, a solid knowledge and experience of using AI/Machine Learning, data analytics, data visualization or optimization is necessary. Finally, strong communication skills in spoken and written English are also a requirement.  We see it as advantageous if you have prior research experience and understanding of district heating (DH) networks, including their components, operation, and maintenance.  Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education .  We offer DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.  Salary and appointment terms  The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years with the starting date of February 1st, 2024.  You can read more about career paths at DTU here .  Further information  Further information may be obtained from Associate Professor Maryamsadat Tahavori ( marta@dtu.dk ). You can read more about DTU Engineering Technology at www.engtech.dtu.dk/English .  If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar “ PhD relocation to Denmark and startup “Zoom” seminar ” for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU.  Application procedure Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 7 December 2023 (23:59 Danish time).  Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale  List of publications and maximum 2 examples of relevant publications, in case you have any publications  References (names and e-mails)   You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it.  Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.  About DTU Engineering Technology We work at the forefront of university-industry collaboration and develop tools and methods for technology implementation. We are organized in 9 research groups all focused on technology implementation, engineering technology and engineering education within a wide range of engineering fields.  Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. title: Metodestærk deltidsmedarbejder inden for statistik, data- og computer science eller lignende - DTU Management
description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                     Esc                                 Metodestærk deltidsmedarbejder inden for statistik, data- og computer science eller lignende - DTU Management        Kgs. Lyngby, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   Metodestærk deltidsmedarbejder inden for statistik, data- og computer science eller lignende søges til Transport Divisionen på DTU Management – Institut for teknologi, ledelse og økonomi.  Til Transport Divisionen på DTU Management – Institut for teknologi, ledelse og økonomi søger vi en deltidsmedarbejder, som kan assistere med forskellige opgaver vedr. blandt andet vedligeholdelse af data og modeller samt udarbejdelse af statistiske, økonomiske og økonometriske analyser inden for transportområdet.  Har du lyst til at arbejde med forskning og forskningsbaseret rådgivning? Og kunne du tænke dig at indgå i vores engagerede studenterteam, hvor dine faglige kompetencer fra studiet anvendes i praksis til samfundsrelevante problemstillinger?  Transport Divisionen på DTU Management – Institut for teknologi, ledelse og økonomi arbejder med forskning og forskningsbaseret rådgivning som skal hjælpe til at forbedre beslutningsgrundlaget for transportpolitik og infrastrukturbeslutninger. Målet er at understøtte den grønne omstilling, samtidig med at samfundet sikres en god og sikker mobilitet. Transportdivisionen fokuserer på forskning og rådgivning inden for transportøkonomi, transportmodeller, machine learning og trafiksikkerhed.  Transport Divisionen er vært for den løbende Transportvaneundersøgelsen, som beskriver den danske befolknings transportvaner, bidrager med udvikling af Transportministeriets Grønne Mobilitetsmodel, og vi har en lang række projekter, der indsamler nye data og udvikler modeller baseret herpå; heriblandt et stort eksperiment med vejafgifter ”Forsøg med vejafgifter for personbiler”.  Jobbet Transport Divisionen søger deltidsmedarbejder(du kan evt. være studerende) som kan bidrage til vedligeholdelse af data og modeller samt udarbejdelse af analyser inden for transportområdet.  Vi lægger vægt på at inddrage vores studenter i alle dele af vores arbejde. Du vil både skulle arbejde selvstændigt og i samarbejde med Instituttets forskere særligt inden for trafikmodellering og machine learning.  Dine opgaver kan blandt andet være:   Assistance med vores store eksperiment med Vejafgifter, herunder bl.a. dataprocessering, -visualisering, -analyser samt eventuelt modeludvikling  Databehandling og kvalitetskontrol af data i Transportvaneundersøgelsen  Udarbejdelse af statistiske analyser  Assistance i forbindelse med udarbejdelse af spørgeskemaundersøgelser og interviewundersøgelser  Udvikling af metoder, der automatiserer håndtering og validering af data, gerne med brug af machine learning  Assistance i forbindelse med nye dataindsamlings metoder, f.eks. GPS, teledata, billedgenkendelse, simulatorer  Såfremt du har erfaring med machine learning, er der mulighed for at benytte dette til løsning af mere komplekse arbejdsopgaver   Vores forventninger til dig Vi forestiller os, at du kan være studerende med en stærk faglig profil inden for statistik, data og computer science eller lign. Derudover:   Har du gode evner for og lyst til at arbejde med programmering. Kendskab til Python eller lignende er en fordel  Har du erfaring med software til statistiske analyser samt gerne med arbejde med databaser og Geografiske Informationssystemer  Har du en god talforståelse, er analytisk skarp og har gode formuleringsevner  Er ansvarsbevidst og trives med at arbejde såvel individuelt som sammen med andre.   Hvad tilbyder vi dig På DTU bliver du en del af en af Europas førende forsknings- og uddannelsesinstitutioner. Du kommer ind i en organisation, der har til formål at udvikle viden på internationalt niveau. Du kan se frem til at få en udfordrende og udviklende arbejdsplads med høj faglighed. Vi sørger selvfølgelig for, at du samtidig får den nødvendige sparring og kompetenceudvikling.  Løn og ansættelsesvilkår Løn- og ansættelsesvilkår i henhold til overenskomst for akademikere i staten eller i henhold til LC/CO10-fællesoverenskomsten og organisationsaftale for IT-medarbejdere (Prosa) i statens tjeneste.  Arbejdstiden vil være ca. 10-15 timer om ugen og efter aftale. Der er mulighed for fleksibilitet i forbindelse med eks. dine ferier, eksamensperioder og større opgaver.   Arbejdssted er på DTUs campus i Lyngby.  Ansøgning og kontakt Vi skal modtage din online ansøgning senest den 10. december 2023. Åbn linket "Ansøg nu", hvor du udfylder ansøgningsformularen samt vedhæfter motiveret ansøgning, CV og eksamensbeviser.  Ønsker du flere oplysninger om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vicedivisionsleder Ninette Pilegaard på tlf 45 25 65 54 eller mail nipi@dtu.dk eller sektionsleder Thomas Kjær Rasmussen på tlf. 45256562 eller mail tkra@dtu.dk  Ansøgninger modtaget efter ansøgningsfristens udløb tages ikke i betragtning.  Alle interesserede uanset alder, køn, handicap, race, religion eller etnisk tilhørsforhold, opfordres til at søge stillingen.  DTU Management forsker i samspillet mellem ledelse, teknologi og økonomi. Vi udvikler løsninger i tæt samarbejde med virksomheder og myndigheder. Vores forskning har til formål at styrke velfærd, produktivitet og bæredygtighed i samfundet. Et nøgleelement er teknologiens rolle og dens interaktion med erhverv og mennesker. Instituttet er delt op i fire divisioner: Technology & Business Studies, Management Science, Climate & Energy Policy og Transportation Science. På uddannelsesområdet bidrager DTU Management til en lang række af DTUs ingeniøruddannelser på bachelor-, kandidat- og ph.d.-niveau. Vi tilbyder et internationalt miljø med ca. 200 ansatte, hvor omkring halvdelen er fra udlandet.  Teknologi for mennesker DTU udvikler teknologi for mennesker. Med vores forskning og uddannelser i international topklasse er vi med til at skabe en bedre verden, og vi bidrager til løsningen af de globale udfordringer formuleret i FN’s 17 verdensmål for en bæredygtig udvikling. H.C. Ørsted grundlagde DTU i 1829 med en klar mission om at udvikle og nyttiggøre naturvidenskab og teknisk videnskab til gavn for samfundet. Den mission lever den dag i dag. DTU har 13.500 studerende og 6.000 ansatte. Vi arbejder i en international atmosfære og har et inkluderende, udviklende og uformelt arbejdsmiljø. DTU har campusser i hele Danmark og i Grønland og samarbejder med de bedste universiteter verden over. description:

Loven fastslår, at vi kan gemme cookies på din enhed, hvis de er strengt nødvendige for at sikre leveringen af den tjeneste, du udtrykkeligt har anmodet om at bruge. For alle andre typer cookies skal vi indhente dit samtykke. Dette websted bruger forskellige typer af cookies. Nogle cookies sættes af tredjeparts tjenester, der vises på vores sider. Du kan til enhver tid ændre eller tilbagetrække dit samtykke fra Cookiedeklarationen på vores hjemmeside. Få mere at vide om, hvem vi er, hvordan du kan kontakte os, og hvordan vi behandler persondata i vores Privatlivspolitik. Angiv venligst dit samtykke-ID og -dato, når du kontakter os angående dit samtykke. Dit samtykke gælder for følgende domæner: candidate.hr-manager.net/ Cookiedeklarationen er sidst opdateret d. 11/9/23 af Cookiebot           Your current state: Deny. Your current state: Do not sell or share my personal information. Your current state: Allow selection (Necessary , Preferences , Statistics , Marketing ). Your current state: Allow all. Your consent ID: 0 Consent date: Change your consent | Withdraw your consent Do not sell or share my personal information    Advarsel Din browser er forældet. Få den bedste brugeroplevelse med hurtigere hastighed, sikkerhed og privatliv ved at bruge den nyeste version af Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari eller Opera.   ×                                         Data scientists til dataanalyse og machine learning i Skattestyrelsen - Ribe            Er du interesseret i at analysere og sætte strøm til Danmarks måske største datasæt i et stærkt data scientist miljø? Vil du være med til at levere indsigter og løsninger, der skaber og styrker fundamentet for fremtidens personbeskatning i Danmark? Trives du med at arbejde agilt og teambaseret i tæt samarbejde med forretningen, mens du har det sjovt? Så er du højst sandsynlig vores nye kollega i Proceskontor for data og analyse.   Lidt om kontoret Kontorets formål er at sikre løbende forretningsudvikling af personbeskatningen i Danmark. Det gør vi gennem strategisk prioriterede projekter og ved anvendelse af fremtidens vigtigste ressource, nemlig data . Vi har brug for dine kompetencer til at indfri potentialet, så vi kan accelerere fremtidens skatteadministration til gavn for vores fælles velfærdssamfund. Vi har store ambitioner og mange emner i backloggen, så vi har brug for flere dygtige kolleger til eksekveringen.  Vi er 27 kollegaer, hvoraf 7 kolleger arbejder fokuseret med at lave ML-modeller til beslutningsstøtte. Du bliver en del af et fagligt fællesskab indenfor data og en del af et kontor præget af nytænkning, kreativitet og stor entusiasme. Vi sætter stor pris på kontinuerlig metodeafprøvning.  Vi råder over måske et af Danmarks største datasæt, og vi ønsker at omsætte det til relevant beslutningsstøtte for forretningen. Vores ML-modeller er en grundlæggende forudsætning for, at Skattestyrelsen kan lykkes med sin opgave som myndighed, og vores mandat til opgaven er strategisk forankret. Skattestyrelsen står ved begyndelsen af en større digital transformation, og hvis du har lyst, så har vi lige nu 3 nye pladser ved bordet. Vi skal ikke hjem, vi skal videre – skal du med?  Arbejdet er funderet i en struktureret tilgang til forretningsudvikling via en værktøjskasse med udviklingsmetoder, som vi konstant opdaterer. Vi anvender fx en agil mødestruktur, som er tilpasset opgaven, hvor vi planlægger vores opgaver i 14-dages sprints med bl.a. daglige stand-ups, midway reviews og retrospectives, ligesom vi arbejder i faste teams.   Vi har brug for en kollega, som vil holde af at   identificere og rense data, samt udvikle og teste statistiske og maskinlæringsbaserede modeller,  deltage i implementering af statistiske og maskinlæringsbaserede modeller,  fokusere på kontinuerlige forbedringer af kommende generationer af statistiske modeller gennem implementering af indsigter fra nuværende modeller,  assistere dine kollegaer i teamet med at træffe strategiske beslutninger baseret på data,  formidle din viden om data til dine kollegaer og vores ledelse samt uddanne kollegaer, så de selv kan bruge løsningerne efter idriftsættelse.   Vi fordeler opgaverne i teamet i forhold til kompetencer og interesser, og opgaverne kan derfor i vid udstrækning tilpasses dine personlige præferencer. Det vigtigste er, at vi sammen skaber et match mellem dine ønsker og kompetencer og den konkrete opgave.   Vi kender dig ikke endnu, men måske kan du genkende dig selv i:   Du har erfaring med databearbejdning og manipulation.  Du har solid programmeringserfaring og har tidligere arbejdet med eller kan nemt sætte dig ind i programmeringssprog som R, SQL og Python.  Vi arbejder i teams, så det er centralt, at du er samarbejdsorienteret og i stand til at formidle komplekse indsigter både mundtligt, skriftligt og i visualiseringer (fx PowerPoints til vores ledelse). Da al formidling foregår på dansk, er det vigtigt, at du læser, taler og skriver dansk på forretningsniveau.  Vi er mere interesseret i dine kompetencer og din personlighed end din uddannelsesmæssige baggrund, men du har formentlig en relevant databasseret, naturvidenskabelig eller matematisk baggrund eller har opnået din erfaring gennem tidligere jobs eller interesse.  Du besidder en god forretningsforståelse, der gør dig i stand til at sætte dig ind i Skattestyrelsens udfordringer.  Du arbejder struktureret og evner at skabe overblik over ustruktureret data, så dine dataanalyser kan bidrage til at skabe forandringer for forretningen.  Da vi er i startfasen af vores opgave, er det også vigtigt, at du er forandringsparat og helt naturligt ser forandring som en åbning til nye muligheder.  Dine kommende kollegaer er både ansvarsbevidste, imødekommende og proaktive. Vi har god, lun humor og har ofte mange bolde i luften på én gang. Så du vil passe bedst ind, hvis du kan se dig selv i sådan et team.   Du må gerne slå os op på LinkedIn, men her er hvad vi kan sige om os selv helt kort   Vi har et rigtigt godt hold bestående af to kontorchefer, en souschef og 27 medarbejdere, som kommer rigtig godt ud af det med hinanden.  Vi sætter stor pris på sparring og udveksling af erfaringer – og vi husker altid på, at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde. Derfor dyrker vi også teambuilding som en fast del af vores arbejdsuge.  Vi er vilde med vores arbejde og knokler for at opnå resultater, men vi nyder også at have fri. Vi har alle familie, børn, venner eller fritidsinteresser, som vi elsker at bruge tid på. Derfor går vi op i, at der skal være balance mellem arbejde og privatliv.  Du får et skræddersyet introduktionsforløb med mentorordning og sidemandsoplæring.  Kontoret er kendetegnet ved en stærk og tryg læringskultur, hvor vi løbende reflekterer over modus og resultater og giver hinanden feedback og evaluerer forløb. Vi er opmærksomme på personlige styrker og udviklingspunkter og vi skaber rum til at tænke over opgaveløsningen.   Skatteministeriet lægger vægt på at understøtte fleksible arbejdsvilkår, og rammerne for arbejdstilrettelæggelsen drøftes mellem leder og medarbejder med udgangspunkt i den samlede opgaveløsning.   Kontakt og ansættelsesvilkår Ansøgning, CV og eksamensbevis bedes sendt via linket ’Søg stillingen’ senest den 30. november 2023. Spørgsmål besvares gerne af kontorchef Kristian Kaack Ovesen på telefon 72 37 22 79 eller kontorchef Karl Kristian Andersen på telefon 72 38 33 03.  Vi har planlagt at afholde første runde samtaler den 5. december 2023. Hvis du går videre, skal du afsætte tid til udfyldelse af en logiktest, personprofilanalyse og en case inden anden runde samtale, der afholdes den 11. december 2023. Der vil forud for ansættelsen blive indhentet straffeattest og referencer. Stillingen ønskes besat snarest muligt eller den 1. februar 2024.  Du bliver ansat på overenskomstvilkår i henhold til enhver tid gældende overenskomst for akademikere i staten (AC), overenskomst for kontorfunktionærer, laboranter og It-medarbejdere (HK) eller overenskomst for fuldmægtige m.fl. (DTS) i Skatteministeriet.  Du bliver ansat i Skatteministeriet med tilhørende institutioner. Arbejdsstedet er Sorsigvej 35, 6760 Ribe.      Om Skattestyrelsen  ’Vi sikrer, at borgere og virksomheder betaler korrekte skatter og afgifter til tiden’   Vi søger løbende nye kolleger, som deler vores ambition om at sikre finansieringen af det, vi er fælles om.   Uanset, hvilken jobfunktion du skal varetage i Skattestyrelsen, kommer du til at arbejde med at sikre finansieringen af velfærdssamfundet og meget af det, der skaber sammenhængskraft i Danmark; skoler, hospitaler, veje og meget mere. Vores organisation er fyldt med specialister, der arbejder sammen på tværs af mange forskellige fagligheder og geografisk placering, så du bliver en del af et mangfoldigt fællesskab, hvor vi løser komplekse og krævende opgaver. Som ny vil du opleve, at læringskurven er stejl, og at du opbygger kompetencer, der vil følge dig i din videre karriere.  Læs mere om Skattestyrelsen på www.sktst.dk .  Skattestyrelsen opfordrer alle

title: Data scientist for image analysis of biomedical data
description: Create job agent    Available positions   Login My profile My profile                          Data scientist for image analysis of biomedical data   Do you have a passion for automated image analysis using AI and machine learning. AI has emerged as an important tool for studying complex disease endpoints. At Gubra we rely on advanced image analysis to extract quantitative information from large microscopy datasets. This is a fast-growing field, and we have a vacant position to advance and support our pipeline. So if you are motivated by working in a multi-disciplinary environment, this might be an exciting opportunity for you at Gubra.  You will be part of AI Technology that consists of highly passionate data scientists. The department develops smart and tailor-made solutions to understand and visualize biological problems in close collaboration with scientists spanning multiple disciplines, often with short yet realistic deadlines. Furthermore, our experts engage in scientific discussions, various data management and software development tasks. Gubra is an ambitious biotech company striving for excellence at all levels. We insist on doing things efficiently – and often differently - to reach the results we aim for. Our vision is to become leaders in the fight for a more sustainable and healthier world. We do that by facilitating the discovery of new medicines, and by acting and inspiring others to fight against the ongoing climate and biodiversity crisis.  You can work independently but understand that being part of a team is the way to success. You take ownership over your tasks and can transform complicated data to valuable interpretable results. You can explain your computational problem-solving and solutions to non-computational-science-experts to non-department colleagues and our customers. You have an eye for automation and validation of processes and constantly look to optimize tasks and steps that can be better solved by a computer than by humans.  The tasks include, but are not limited to:  Development and maintenance of our automated image analysis (2D and 3D) pipelines spanning raw data acquisition all the way to the final data packages for internal/external customers Establish QC and validation steps in our workflows to ensure high-quality data packages Support our CRO business with data analysis and scientific counselling and collaborate across multiple disciplines Facilitate communication between the AI Technology department and our sales department Take part in the daily scientific research, discussions, and presentations internally and externally  As a candidate for the job, you possess several of the qualifications below  A relevant master or Ph.D. degree Experience in processing and analysis of biomedical image data, using both classical and deep learning approaches Writing well-structured and readable code Can comfortably work in a Linux server environment Familiarity with statistics and common data science approaches Proficiency in version control in git, Github, Azure or similar tools Biological knowledge of e.g. brain, cardiac, liver, or kidney pathologies  As a person you are  Highly enthusiastic about data analysis and computational biology Detail-oriented and motivated by going the extra mile to deliver high-quality data Excited about new insights and data Keen to take on responsibility within your area of expertise Curious by nature, motivated by data and not afraid to challenge status quo Proactive and able to initiate, focus and deliver on tasks and projects Able to navigate and collaborate in an energetic and rapidly changing organization Appreciating being part of a collaborative team  Please apply no later than December 3, 2023 by uploading your motivated cover letter and resume on our website. We will be processing incoming applications continually. If you have any questions about the position, please contact Department Manager Casper Salinas at cgs@gubra.dk. About Gubra  Gubra is an ambitious and innovative biotech company striving for excellence at all levels. We insist on doing things efficiently – and often differently - to reach the results we aim for. Our vision is to become leaders in the fight for a more sustainable and healthier world. We do that by facilitating the discovery of new medicine, and by acting and inspiring others to fight against the ongoing climate and biodiversity crises. We have two primary areas of business: Preclinical contract research (CRO) services, and Proprietary early target and drug discovery programs. We are a biotech company delivering science to our partners and to our own research projects. We are active in the so-called pre-clinical space - before drugs are tested in humans - and generate our revenue by performing research for small and large pharma companies. Our focus is within the metabolic space (obesity, diabetes, NASH (Non-alcoholic steatohepatitis), and diabetic complications), where we specialize in in vivo pharmacology, peptide chemistry, molecular pharmacology, histology, stereology, imaging, NGS (next generation sequencing), bioinformatics and biomarker assays. We work with some of the most interesting and loyal partners and customers from across the world within big pharma, biotech, and academia. Through a constant focus on high quality, scientific excellence, speed, and solid teamwork we have established ourselves as a highly professional and competent partner in the market. People are our greatest asset, and our team consists of +210 employees all located in Hørsholm, Denmark. The mix of people from different cultures and educational backgrounds combined with our entrepreneurial mindset have greatly impacted our working environment, which is characterized by intensive drive, scientific curiosity, and teamwork – we join forces!  Apply   Share in your network                Deadline:  03/12/2023     Contact person:    Casper Gravesen Gravesen Salinas  Department Manager       Mail:    cgs@gubra.dk       Job area:  AI Technology    Employment terms:  Full time                                   Powered by Emply          Login  Have you applied for a job or created a job agent? title: PhD scholarship in Computer Vision with Deep Learning for Human-Machine Collaboration – DTU Compute
description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 PhD scholarship in Computer Vision with Deep Learning for Human-Machine Collaboration – DTU Compute        Kgs. Lyngby, Denmark                    Trending                                        Jobbeskrivelse   Do you want to advance the state-of-the-art research in computer vision systems using human-machine collaboration? The Technical University of Denmark (DTU) invites you to apply for a fully funded 3-year PhD position. The position is funded by the Sapere Aude: DFF-Starting grant . The position is offered at DTU, in the Department of Computer Science and Applied Mathematics, at the Visual Computing Group , and will work closely with researchers from the Pioneer Centre for AI . Project description Learning visual recognition models requires huge amounts of data, especially when relying on data-hungry deep neural networks. These data need to be manually and passively annotated by humans. This labeling procedure is one of the most important steps in a machine learning pipeline and is tedious, expensive, and susceptible to noise leading to erroneous labels. We aim to establish a deeper human-machine collaboration for all stages of the learning pipeline via multimodal labeling and learning. The goal of this project is to leverage information from different modalities that naturally occur near web images to assist the image annotation.  You will develop state-of-the-art multimodal models for self-supervision with human-in-the-loop text supervision. This PhD project will be supervised by Associate Professor (DTU). Responsibilities During the PhD program, you will:   Work with state-of-the-art deep learning computer vision models.  Develop state-of-the-art models for human-machine collaboration in computer vision.  Publish scientific papers and present research results in top computer vision conferences (CVPR, ECCV, ICCV).  Spend a few months during the PhD program abroad.  Work as a teaching assistant in courses at DTU.   Qualifications To succeed in this position, you should have the following required skills:   A master’s degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar in Computer Science, Informatics, Computer Engineering, Applied Mathematics or equivalent.  Proven experience in Python.  Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks.  High level of motivation and innovation.  Experience in computer vision is a plus.   Excellent written and communication skills in English. Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education . Assessment The assessment of the applicants will be made by Associate Professor Dimitrios Papadopoulos . We offer DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility. Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years; start in Spring or Summer 2024. You can read more about career paths at DTU here . Further information  If you have questions, you are very welcome to contact Associate Professor Dimitrios Papadopoulos at dimp@dtu.dk . If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar “ PhD relocation to Denmark and startup “Zoom” seminar ” for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU. Application procedure Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 2 January 2024  (23:59 Danish time) . Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae (CV)  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale   Incomplete applications will not be considered. You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it. Applications received after the deadline will not be considered. All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply. DTU Compute DTU Compute is a unique and internationally recognized academic department with 385 employees and 11 research sections spanning the science disciplines mathematics, statistics, computer science, and engineering. We conduct research, teaching and innovation of high international standard – producing new knowledge and technology-based solutions to societal challenges. We have a long-term involvement in applied and interdisciplinary research, big data and data science, artificial intelligence (AI), internet of things (IoT), smart and secure societies, smart manufacturing, and life science. At DTU Compute we believe in a diverse workplace with a flexible work-life balance. Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. title: PhD Student in Wind Turbine Load Surrogate for Wind Farm Control - DTU Wind
description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 PhD Student in Wind Turbine Load Surrogate for Wind Farm Control - DTU Wind        Roskilde, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   Are you a curious, self-driven individual with a strong passion for developing sustainable energy solutions? The Department of Wind and Energy Systems at the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) invites applications for a PhD position focused on the creation of a Wind Turbine Load Surrogate for Wind Farm Control. This is your opportunity to make a significant contribution towards improving wind farm efficiency and sustainability.  We need a passionate, curious, and enthusiastic new team member committed to addressing climate change through advancing renewable energy systems. We're searching for someone who flourishes in the face of complex problems, isn't afraid to ask probing questions, and possesses the grit to pursue innovative solutions in a rapidly evolving field.  You are a committed individual with a strong engineering or computer science background. You have a keen interest in scientific programming and machine learning. Your curiosity guides you to explore and understand the intricacies of wind energy systems, and your self-guided nature encourages you to push the limits of what is today possible for a better tomorrow.  You have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree.  As a PhD candidate, you will be tasked with the creation of dynamic and transient load surrogates that can interface with both reduced order models of wind farm wake flow and Dynamic Wake Meandering (DWM) type of engineering models. The aim is to develop versatile load surrogates that can predict time series or statistics of power and loads based on a range of data-driven/machine learning methodologies. Such models can accelerate the prediction of wind farm performance, and be used to devise sophisticated wind farm control strategies.  This project is co-financed by the EU-H2020 SUDOCO project , which focuses on developing new methods for the control co-design of offshore wind farms. In line with the goals of the SUDOCO project, the load surrogate should be capable of predicting changes in power and loads with respect to control set-points such as yaw misalignment, global pitch/RPM changes and cyclic pitch RPM.  You will get  the chance to work in one of the best Technical University Europe, at the Risø campus, the cradle and world renown campus of innovation and research in wind energy.  Furthermore, by being part of an EU project you will have the opportunity to meet regularly and work closely with a distributed team of experts, both from academia and wind industry located all across Europe.  Required Qualifications and Competencies  - A Master's degree in an engineering field or computer science - Proficiency in scientific Python programming - A background in machine learning  Desirable additional background knowledge  - Wind energy - Data-driven methods, such as SVD/POD and deep learning - Control or optimization - Wind turbine aero-elastic modelling - Wind farm flow physics (wind farm wake)  Wind and Energy System Department is a mission-oriented organisation focused on accelerating the development and integration of wind based energy systems. The System Engineering and Optimization (SYS) section work closely with experts from all across the department and companies to create simulation, design and control solutions for wind farm, wind clusters and hybrid-power plants.  DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation, and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.  Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programs at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study program, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education .  Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years.  You can read more about career paths at DTU here .  Further information Further information may be obtained from Head of Section, Pierre-Elouan Réthoré tel.: +45 21331293, pire@dtu.dk  You can read more about DTU Wind at http://www.vindenergi.dtu.dk/   If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar " PhD relocation to Denmark and startup "Zoom" seminar " for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU.  Application procedure . Your complete online application must be submitted no later 15 December 2023 (23:59 Danish time) .  Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English), including an official description of the grading scale   You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it.  Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates, irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion, or ethnic background, are encouraged to apply.  Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                  Senior Software Engineer   Cloud Services   |   Backend   |   Infrastructure   |   Data Science   |   Machine Learning  We are looking for a senior software engineer that can work alongside our data scientists to develop cloud-based analytics and machine learning solutions for the food production industry world-wide.  Scio+ is part of the SKOV A/S group of companies and we are the competence center for data-driven and vision-based solutions for the food production industry within the livestock segment. We provide production insights and predictions by applying machine learning techniques to discrete data and vision data from farm production sites. These innovative solutions focus on bringing added value to the production by optimizing processes, reducing cost and not least by reducing environmental footprint and improving animal welfare.  Working in Scio+  You will be a member of an international, skilled, highly motivated and self-driven team of software developers and data scientists spanning different educational backgrounds and competences. We do weekly sprint-like iterations, focusing our work on what adds value to our customers. We work as a DevOps teams meaning that we are responsible for developing, running and maintain our services.  We expect you to be passionate about development infrastructure backend and deployment of machine learning solutions. We value individuals who have an open and positive attitude towards colleagues, are ambitious about their work, and what we can achieve together.  You will be working together with colleagues in other development teams which are located globally in our regional offices.  What profile are we looking for?   You have a master's or PhD degree in computer science, engineering or in a related field  You are an experienced software developer (3-5 years+) that understand the challenges in designing and implementing and running cloud-based services  You have experience in delivering solutions using continuous integration and continuous delivery. It is beneficial if you have experience with continuous training of ML models  You have experience in Java, and it is a plus if you know .Net and Python.  You have experience with Azure or other cloud platforms like AWS or GCP  You have experience with Event-Streaming Platforms such as Apache Kafka or Azure Eventhub  You care about agile development processes and continuously improving velocity and applications  You like to foster the agile mindset within the group  You know the importance of data security  You are a great team player with a willingness to take responsibility in completing the different tasks for us to reach our goals together  You are flexible when it comes to tasks and able to keep an overview of multiple tasks in a sometimes hectic environment   What would you actually be doing?   Support, improve and maintain our current cloud infrastructure backend  Building reliable and secure data collection systems for experimentations and for production-ready systems  Create transparency on the health and the performance of cloud infrastructure for solutions in production and drive optimizations on operation and costs  Participate in chapter-work with other development teams in our group  Impact new products development on the infrastructure side   Join us  We offer a flexible work arrangement with respect for a healthy work–life balance for all employees, and a unique opportunity to make your impact on the organization as it grows together with you. We offer you to join social activities with your colleagues, also here we hope you might have a great idea for some activities.  Want to know more?  Please contact Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown, phone +45 88 74 11 43 or by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com  Apply for the job  We are assessing applications on an ongoing basis, so please send your cover letter, CV and relevant attachments as soon as possible to Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com     Scio+ is an ambitious young company working at the forefront of data science in the food production sector. Our vision is to be a world class partner in data driven livestock yield optimization and our mission is to optimize livestock food production yield across the entire value chain by providing reliable data driven insights.        Apply for position  Application due: 12/29/2023  Workplace: Denmark  Position category: Research & Development        Share/Print    Questions regarding the position        Simon Binderup Johansen   Business Development Director  sij@skov.dk  +4572175588                                                                                ShareThis Copy and Paste

Does this sounds wonderful to you? Then have a look. Who we are At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services. Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world. With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes. Sounds wonderful? Then keep on reading The Team To deliver on our purpose to make wonderful sound part of everyone’s life, we are strengthening our capabilities with an additional, passionate, and purpose-driven team player in our AI Fitting Accelerator. This is a newly established unit, that is inspired by the opportunity to advance the hearing aid industry with AI-based innovations. You will get to learn a bit more about the innovations, that you will be working on, further along in the recruitment process. As it is a self-sustaining unit, it will handle the entire innovation cycle, from idea generation, through prototyping and testing, to product delivery. To do so, the team will foster a creative spirit while being on the forefront of newest technologies. You will be part of a team with an informal culture and consisting of skilled and dedicated individuals lifting together. The Role As our new Data Engineer , you will be building the bridge between our centralized data team (that are responsible for ingesting production data from various sources into a central data lake), and the AI Fitting Accelerator, by developing and maintaining a data eco-system that is the foundation of our machine learning projects. Main responsibilities and tasks e.g.  Ingesting production data, understanding the underlying hearing aid data domain, and ensuring development of a data model architecture that exposes the data in an interpretable way ready for data analysts, data scientists and other data consumers.  Collaborating with data scientists on machine learning projects by delivering curated datasets that are ready for predictive modelling, as well as seeking out opportunities where a data-centric approach can support move the project forward.  Building core infrastructure for data-driven products in collaboration with software and machine learning engineers.  About You To be successful in the role as our new Data Engineer you recognize that having quality data requires an understanding of where and how the data is generated, and thus what real-world process it describes. Therefore, you enjoy interacting with subject matter experts to understand the reality in the data you provide. You are a team player who seeks design feedback and engage in constructive discussions with your fellow colleagues. To summarize, we are hoping to see the following qualifications in you:  Master’s Degree within Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field  Python machine learning/data science stack (such as Torch, Tensorflow, scikit-learn, ClearML, etc.)  Distributed data processing frameworks (such as Databricks, Spark, Hadoop, etc.)  Cloud development and deployment (we use Microsoft Azure)  As person we expect you to be creative, have attention to detail, and a collaborative attitude that you see as a part of what defines you. You can work with a range of programming languages and tools, depending on the project requirements. You have a diverse computer science foundation that enables you to learn and apply new skills as needed. The corporate language is English, so you need to have professional proficiency in English both verbally and in writing. What we would like to offer you The working environment at WS Audiology is informal with helpful and skilled colleagues. Our values focus on teamwork across functions, pioneering as well as having the passion to make an impact. So, if you can see yourself in those values, you will fit right in. The benefits we can offer include an advantageous pension scheme with health insurance, sports and arts club as well as good canteen facilities. Our Danish headquarter, is a CO2 friendly and modern facility with beautiful surroundings close to Allerød north of Copenhagen, Denmark.  Sounds wonderful? Join us Please submit your CV as soon as possible. We will screen and invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, but the latest deadline is the 1st of December 2023 . In case you have any questions, you are more than welcome to contact Caspar Bang Jespersen at caspar.jespersen@wsa.com WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self. title: Ingeniør med kompetencer indenfor dataanalyse og software
description: Tryk på Tab for at skifte til Gå til indholdslink  Gå til hovedindhold                             Sprog    Dansk (Danmark)    Lietuvių (Lietuva)    Deutsch (Deutschland)    English (United Kingdom)    Suomi (Suomi)    Polski (Polska)    Slovenčina (Slovensko)    Svenska (Sverige)       Vis profil                 Karrieremuligheder hos Nordzucker Group                                                 Sprog    Dansk (Danmark)    Lietuvių (Lietuva)    Deutsch (Deutschland)    English (United Kingdom)    Suomi (Suomi)    Polski (Polska)    Slovenčina (Slovensko)    Svenska (Sverige)       Vis profil                 Karrieremuligheder hos Nordzucker Group                                     Karrieremuligheder hos Nordzucker Group             Sprog    Dansk (Danmark)    Lietuvių (Lietuva)    Deutsch (Deutschland)    English (United Kingdom)    Suomi (Suomi)    Polski (Polska)    Slovenčina (Slovensko)    Svenska (Sverige)       Vis profil                                            Søg på nøgleord        Søg efter land       Indlæser...        Land/region    Alle                            ×     Vælg, hvor ofte (i dage) der modtages en besked:     Opret jobagent         ×     Vælg, hvor ofte (i dage) der modtages en besked:                Ansøg nu »             Ingeniør med kompetencer indenfor dataanalyse og software til Nordic Sugar              •    Vil du samarbejde med højtspecialiserede kolleger og udvikle dig på tværs af landegrænser som en del af en international virksomhed? •    Vil du spille en rolle i fremtidens sukkerfabrikker og være med i spændende projekter, hvor vi arbejder mod mere automation og hvor data spiller en stadig højere rolle ? •    Har du lyst til en hverdag i en højt automatiseret procesindustri, der producerer tonsvis af sukker og foderprodukter fra sukkerroer? •    Hvor vi har en strategi om sustainability og vejen mod en CO2 neutral produktion.  Som vores nye kollega deltager du i vigtige projekter, der på sigt baner vejen for fuldautomatiske sukkerfabrikker.    Ansættelse i Nordic Sugar med reference til hele Nordzucker-koncernen  Vores danske Digitalisering og Teknologi Service-afdeling (DTS) er placeret i Nakskov. DTS har en betydningsfuld rolle som en stabsfunktion i Nordzucker-koncernen med kontorer i Braunschweig og Nakskov. Nordzucker har sukkerproduktion på 13 fabrikker i 7 lande i Europa, samt 3 fabrikker i Australien. I Danmark har vi fabrikker i Nykøbing F. og Nakskov samt hovedkontor i Ørestaden i København.    Som software- og dataanalyseingeniør får du en vigtig rolle Du kommer sammen med dine kollegaer til at drive den fortsatte udvikling af avanceret produktionsautomation udfra databehandling og dataudveksling mellem mange systemer på Nordzucker’s fabrikker.    Dit udgangspunkt bliver vores afdeling i Nakskov. Der er mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra 1-2 dage om ugen i det omfang, det giver mening. Ydermere vil du deltage i projekter i andre lande, som typisk indebærer 20-30 rejsedage om året.   Masser af muligheder på tværs af landegrænser I jobbet vil du have mulighed for at udvikle dig i flere retninger. Dette kunne være inden for projektledelse eller specialistretning. Der kan også på længere sigt være en mulighed for at arbejde i andre lande af længere varighed.    Jobbet: Kollega som synes software og databehandling er spændende  Vi forestiller os, at du har nogle års erfaring med software og databehandling, men vi hører også gerne fra dig, hvis du er nyuddannet, og du har stiftet bekendtskab med automations-, softwareområdet og databaser. Du er uddannet ingeniør (med en bachelor- eller kandidatgrad)  •    Du kommer til at arbejde med grænsefladerne til vores produktionskontrolsystemer (fortrinsvis Siemens PCS7 og Foxboro EVO), instrumenter og vores SAP ERP system. Du hjælper  sammen med dine kolleger med til at udvikle, implementere og vedligeholde avanceret software, interfaces mellem systemer. •    Vi arbejder primært med Microsoft-baserede værktøjer. •    Du vil på sigt også komme til at arbejde med moduler til AI og machine-learning, f.eks. vibrationsgenkendelse, mønstergenkendelse i billeder og data m.m. •    Du har gode matematiske kvalifikationer, analytiske evner og har kendskab til analyse af store datamængder. •    At du har erfaring med programmering og databaser, evt. fra studie. •    At du har interesse for brugerrelateret præsentation af data.    Et godt miljø med god grobund for dig og vores sukkerroer Vi skaber hele tiden en endnu bedre og endnu mere attraktiv arbejdsplads. Vi er nemlig alt andet end en traditionel virksomhed. Vi går langt for, at vores medarbejdere har de bedste forudsætninger for at udvikle deres kompetencer samt mulighed for at vidensdeling, så alle bliver endnu klogere. Ligesom vi tilstræber et miljø hvor vi både er faglige og kan have det sjov sammen.    Når du begynder dit arbejde her hos os, får du derfor også en start periode hvor vi vil sætte dig ind i vores systemer, besøge vores fabrikker og få hilst på en masse nye kollegaer. Vi sørger for, at du nok skal få lært det, som er nødvendigt for stillingen. Og selvom mange af os har været her i rigtig mange år, så har vi ikke glemt, hvordan det er at være ny. Vi besætter ikke stillinger – vi ansætter mennesker med mere end ét talent.  •    Du har interesse for programmering, databaser og dataanalyse. •    Du kan se dig selv i stillingen i en længere årrække, da du kommer gennem en grundig oplæring. •    Du begår dig ubesværet på engelsk i både skrift og tale. •    Du kan begå dig på dansk. •    Du har kørekort til bil eller vil tage det indenfor de første 12 måneder.   Er du interesseret? Kan du se dig selv som vores nye kollega, så send os din ansøgning og dit CV snarest. Vi vil løbende afholde samtaler.    Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Emerging Technologies Jørgen Folm Berg på telefon 2469 8845.   Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig                Vi besætter ikke stillinger. Vi ansætter mennesker med mere end ét talent. I Nordic Sugar vil du opleve en arbejdskultur, som er præget af afveksling og fleksibilitet. Det skaber rum for udvikling i jobbet, både professionelt og personligt, og grobund for, at du kan udfolde alle dine talenter – også uden for landets grænser.  Nordic Sugar er en del af Nordzucker-koncernen, der er baseret i Braunschweig, Tyskland, og er en af verdens førende sukkerproducenter. Vores produktsortiment inden for sukkerroer og sukkerrør omfatter hvidt sukker, råsukker, specialiteter og flydende sukker. Derudover producerer virksomheden foder, melasse, gødning og bioethanol samt elektricitet. Bæredygtighed i hele værdikæden har høj prioritet.  I alt 3.800 ansatte på 21 europæiske og australske fabrikker og raffinaderier på tværs af koncernen stræber mod at levere fremragende produkter og serviceydelser og danner således grundlaget for yderligere vækst.  I alle vores aktiviteter sætter vi dagligt handling bag vores ambition om at være en miljømæssig, social og økonomisk bæredygtig virksomhed: Vi skal være en attraktiv arbejdsplads, en stærk forretningspartner og et aktiv for lokalsamfundet. title: Optimization Analyst
description: 31.300 job i dag         For jobsøgere    For arbejdsgivere     DA    EN          Log ind  Opret profil                Jobsøgning       Søg job Vælg mellem flere søgekriterier    Din side Skab overblik over din jobsøgning      Jobagent Få nye job direkte i din indbakke    CV Opret dit CV og bliv headhuntet      QuickApply-profil Søg jobbet nemt fra mobilen    Jobannoncearkiv Find inspiration i udløbne jobopslag      Få en jobvejleder Bliv afklaret i din jobsøgning    Jobs For Ukraine Hjælper ukrainske flygtninge med at få job        Arbejdspladser       Se virksomhedsprofiler Få viden om din næste arbejdsplads      Evaluér arbejdsplads Hvordan er din arbejdsplads?
